description: b-Net income. Share earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split in February. Corrected from April 20th editions.

title: BENEFICIAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After a loss of $12.9 million from discontinued operations.

title: New Political Party in Israel
description: Rabbi Haim Druckman, a Member of Parliament who led protests against Israel's return of Sinai to Egypt last year, announced today that he was starting a new political party to encourage Jewish settlement in Israeli-occupied territories. Rabbi Druckman said he was leaving the National Religious Party, a partner in Prime Minster Menachem Begin's coalition, to create Matzad. The name is an acronym in Hebrew for Religious Zionist Party.

title: Deloitte Haskins & Sells Names First Chairman
description: Deloitte Haskins & Sells, one of the Big 8 accounting firms, announced senior management changes yesterday, including the naming of its first chairman.

title: Topics; The Federal Hand; School Prayer
description: The legal thinkers at the Department of Education are determined to keep Federal hands off even where intervention would improve schools, but there is one form of intervention they do endorse: getting elementary and high school students to pray.

title: SPECIALIZED SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for qtr to Dec 31.
SYMPHONY: ROREM WORK
description: THE highlight of the American Symphony Orchestra's Sunday afternoon concert at Carnegie Hall was the New York premiere of Ned Rorem's Piano Concerto in Six Movements. The concerto, which was written for Jerome Lowenthal in 1969, represents Mr. Rorem at his most deliberately Modernistic, combining a hazy impressionism with an American forthrightness.

title: G.M. Dividend Is Unchanged
description: The board of the General Motors Corporation yesterday continued the quarterly dividend at 60 cents a share, the same rate it has been since the second quarter of 1980.

title: 2 Coaches Feuding
description: Pat Riley, the Los Angeles Laker coach, accused Jack Ramsay, Portland's coach, of sending ''hit men out to rough up'' Kareem Abdul-Jabbar during the Lakers' 108-95 playoff loss to the Trail Blazers Sunday. Ramsay denied the charge, and countered with a charge that the All-Star center got favorable treatment from the referees.

title: Authorities Close 2 Banks
description: The National Bank of Oak Lawn, Ill., and the Heritage Bank of Ashland, Ore., were closed and their assets transferred to other banks, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation said today.

title: AMERICAN STANDARD INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
TV IMPORT CHARGES ARE FILED
description: Manufacturers in South Korea and Taiwan are illegally selling television sets in the United States at prices as much as 60 percent below the fair market value in their home markets, a coalition of American companies and unions charged today.

title: Advertising; Premium Show Crowded
description: IF you wanted to get another exhibitor into the 1983 Premium and Incentive Show that opened its four-day stay at the New York Coliseum yesterday, you'd have to move the brooms out of the broom closets. The place was jampacked.

title: News Summary; TUESDAY, MAY 3, 1983
description: International For years, China's policies in Tibet were a lesson in how not to treat an ethnic minority. Peking forced an alien language, culture and even ideology on the Tibetans, and Chinese agricultural policies pushed thousands of Tibetans to the brink of starvation. Now Peking is trying to undo the damage. (Page A1, Col. 2.) American Motors Corporation expects to sign an accord with China later this week to jointly produce Jeep-type vehicles in Peking and export some of them to other nations in the Far East. (A1:1.)

title: HALLIBURTON CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
BRAE CORP reports earnings for year to March 31.
BOOTHE FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
LABYRINTH
description: Retired middle-class New Yorkers people who worked all their lives and thought their retirements would be secure - are beginning to follow the lead of the aged poor in seeking legal advice to solve problems that just a few years ago were regarded as routine.

title: Cuomo's Impasse Arrives
description: It's a solidly American tradition to root for the underdog who defends his cause to the bitter end. But the supporters of Westway, that grand megadevelopment in the sky, are working on a new tradition - that of the overdog who has lost his case but still won't quit even after the game is over.

title: PLAYS
description: T he scissors kick, or bicycle kick, is a rarity in a soccer game because it is the most difficult play to execute, especially when a player is surrounded by opponents. When the kick is converted into a goal it adds a special dimension to a game.

title: Books Of The Times
description: By Walter Goodman THE AIR-LINE TO SEATTLE. Studies in Literary and Historical Writing About America. By Kenneth S. Lynn. 227 pages. University of Chicago. $17.50.

title: PACE PICKING UP IN TALKS ON LEBANON
description: American and Israeli officials said today that they had made progress in reducing the number of issues holding up an agreement on Israel's withdrawal from Lebanon.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Lower East Side Exotica A15-pound turtle was found strolling down Avenue D on the Lower E ast Side last week.

title: Optimism on Treasury Issues
description: Interest rates rose slightly yesterday, although dealers in Government securities remained optimistic that this week's heavy supply of new Treasury issues can be sold with yields close to current levels.

title: 'THE OLD PROFESSOR' RULES MADRID LIKE AN OLD PRO
description: His face stares down from election posters on a thousand lampposts, peering through spectacles with a confident air, the nose at a jaunty angle, a wisp of white hair around the ears and a slight smile playing on the lips - the perfect model of the selfassured, genial, avuncular academic.

title: CUOMO ADVISER URGES SCRAPPING OF THE WESTWAY
description: A report requested by Governor Cuomo recommends that New York State abandon the Westway highway project in Manhattan and trade in its Federal highway funds for money to help mass transit.

title: KENTUCKY CENTRAL LIFE reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Acme General Corp., San Dimas, Calif., promoted James H. Loomis to president of the Building Products division.

title: Order to Halt Apple 'Copies'
description: Apple Computer Inc. said it had won a preliminary injunction against the distributor of a copy of the Apple II personal computer being sold in the United States.

title: IMS INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
AMERICAN WESTERN SECURITIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
BRUNO'S INC reports earnings for qtr to April 9.
description: Share earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid Jan. 18.

title: MERRIMAC INDUSTRIES reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
GLOBAL TRADE: TO GET THE U.S. ACT TOGETHER
description: To the Editor:

title: BRITISH ARE NEAR ELECTION DECISION
description: Four years ago tomorrow, Margaret Thatcher became Prime Minister. A week from today, she is expected to decide when to seek a second term.

title: Textile Jobs Seen Falling
description: Hundreds of thousands of textile and apparel workers could lose their jobs by the end of the decade as the industry modernizes to meet competition from abroad, a study for the National Science Foundation concluded.

title: The Bank Traffic Needs a Cop
description: The country's top financial officers - Treasury Secretary Regan and Federal Reserve Chairman Volcker - call for a moratorium on the headlong rush of banks, brokers and other financial institutions into each other's traditional businesses. What began as healthy deregulation is becoming a regulatory breakdown, and a freeze would give Congress time to act on new guidelines. But it might easily become an excuse for no action. Better to let the confusion grow and thus push Congress to act.

title: EMCO LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
MUSIC: CLAUDIO ABBADO
description: THE English invasion of Manhattan, which has been proceeding this spring under the banner of the ''Britain Salutes New York'' festival, last night brought the London Symphony into Avery Fisher Hall for a concert under Claudio Abbado's direction. It was a solid program, played with a good deal of virtuosity, though hardly anything that could be filed under the category of ''festival.''

title: AM CHARGED IN S.E.C. FRAUD CASE
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged AM International Inc., the old Addressograph-Multigraph Corporation, with engaging in a wide-ranging fraud to inflate its financial statements in violation of Federal securities laws.

title: DU PONT DE NEMOURS, E I, & CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Mickelberry Earnings Up 26.4% in Quarter
description: The Mickelberry Corporation, a holding company largely made up of advertising agencies, reported a 26.4 percent rise in net income for the first quarter, to $512,000, or 13 cents a share, from $405,000, or 12 cents a share, the year before.

title: THE FOCUS TURNS TO FOREIGN POLICY
description: On Tuesday, the House Intelligence Committee will consider an amendment to bar any American-backed covert intelligence operations in Nicaragua. At the same time, another committee will take testimony on President Reagan's plan to deploy the MX missile, which has already come in for severe criticism. Later in the week, the House will again debate a resolution calling for a freeze on nuclear weapons.

title: TURNER CONSTRUCTION CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Rawlings President To Stress Quality
description: Robert P. Burrows 3d has been named president of the Rawlings Sporting Goods Company of St. Louis. Mr. Burrows, 36, comes to Rawlings, which is a unit of Figgie International, after nine years with Booz, Allen & Hamilton, the management consultants. He succeeds Donald Olesen, who becomes a consultant in Figgie's consumer group.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: The Governor's Bad Back

title: BUCKS WIN, FINISH SWEEP OF THE CELTICS
description: The champagne was on ice, ready for the longawaited celebration. But after the Milwaukee Bucks completed a surprising four-game sweep of the Boston Celtics tonight in the Eastern Conference semifinal playoff series with a convincing 107-93 triumph, not a single cork was popped.

title: Rainier Merger
description: The Rainier Bancorporation of Seattle said it became the first out-of-state bank holding company to acquire an Alaska bank, with the purchase of Peoples Bank and Trust here.

title: 9 Plead Not Guilty In Klan Rally Deaths
description: SALEM, N.C., May 2 (AP) - Six Ku Klux Klansmen and three American Nazis pleaded not guilty today to Federal charges of conspiring to disrupt a 1979 rally at which five anti-Klan demonstrators were shot to death.

title: ZIMMER CORP reports earnings for qtr to April 16.
NORTH-WEST TELECOMMUNICATIONS reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
NEW YORK COLLECTIONS: SUITS, SWEATERS, LONGER SILHOUETTES
description: Geoffrey Beene presented a collection that would be considered of couture caliber if the makers of custom clothes still searched for new constructions and worked in the modern genre.

title: EMPIRE-CROWN AUTO INC reports earnings for qtr to March 26.
Debt Issues
description: * Atlantic Research Corp., Alexandria, Va., filed for an offering of $30 million of convertible subordinated debentures, through Prudential-Bache Securities Inc.

title: ISRAEL CRITICIZES U.S. ON TECHNOLOGY SALE
description: A Reagan Administration decision to place limits on the sale of sensitive technology for the design of wing and tail assemblies of a new fighter to be built in Israel was criticized today by Israeli officials.

title: KATY INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss.

title: G.M. Output Rises by 4.6%
description: The General Motors Corporation said today that its United States auto production rose 4.6 percent in April, to 302,460, from 289,247 a year ago.

title: Comings and Goings
description: The Seattle Mariners have placed Richie Zisk on the 15-day disabled list. The designated hitter, pulled a muscle in his left rib cage during batting practice Sunday. ... Bake McBride of Cleveland says he may retire after the season.

title: THE OPERATING SYSTEM IN THE MIDDLE
description: TRUE, the travel agent had not promised sun in California. But isn't that implied in the very name of the state? Besides, I'd left enough rain back East. ''This deluge is simply too much,'' I muttered to myself as I braked at a sign indicating that the road by which I was returning to San Francisco from Pacific Grove temporarily ended in the Pacific Ocean. Reflecting that the weather seemed altogether out of control these days, I swung the car around to find the detour.

title: EAST GERMANS SEE A COLD-WAR MOOD
description: An East German press commentary accused West Germany today of returning to the cold war in its protest over the deaths of two travelers at the East German border.

title: CHINESE ENVOY CRITICIZES REAGAN OVER SALES OF WEAPONS TO TAIWAN
description: China's Ambassador to the United States accused the Reagan Administration yesterday of ''twisting the meaning'' of the communique signed last August that limits American arms sales to Taiwan.

title: Chess: Ribli, Winner Over Torre, Now Paired With Smyslov
description: Zoltan Ribli of Hungary won his quarterfinal world championship candidates match with Eugenio Torre of the Philippines in Alicante, Spain, by a 6-4 score. Ribli, 32 years old, needed only a draw in the 10th game, but won from Torre, also 32 years old, to achieve a 2-point margin of victory.

title: Mr. B
description: George Balanchine, Igor Stravinsky and Pablo Picasso shared a remarkable century and a remarkable distinction: None of them were ever compared to anyone else. They were clearly hors concours.

title: INSTRON CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including a tax credit of $68,000. c-Net loss.

title: Tubbs Back on Job
description: Ten weeks after suffering a fractured skull when hit by a car, Billy Tubbs returned to his job as Oklahoma basketball coach.

title: CHEEZEM DEVELOPMENT CORP reports earnings for qtr to Jan 31.
New Team for Francis
description: Emile Francis, who built the Rangers and St. Louis Blues into winners during his impressive career as a hockey executive, was named yesterday president and general manager of the Hartford Whalers.

title: Pertini Seeks New Talks On Forming Government
description: President Sandro Pertini asked the Christian Democrat President of the Senate today not to dissolve Parliament and instead to reopen talks with political parties to form a new government.

title: Iran Claims: Status Report
description: President Reagan has told Congress that the tribunal set up to handle American-Iranian claims had settled 35 cases, about 1 percent of the 3,730 total claims, as of the middle of last month.

title: DEBATE ON BUDGET BEGINS IN SENATE WITH G.O.P. DIVIDED
description: The Senate began debate today on a budget for the fiscal year 1984 with the Republicans near agreement on how much to raise military spending but still struggling over how much to increase taxes.

title: FAIRBANKS HOPEFUL ABOUT 3-6 GENERALS
description: Despite a 3-6 record in the first half of the first United States Football League season, Chuck Fairbanks, the coach of the Generals, remains optimistic.

title: UNIVERSAL MONEY CENTERS INC reports earnings for qtr to Jan 31.
TYSON FOODS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Share earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid April 15, 1983.

title: Rating Raised At Duke Power
description: The Duke Power Company's rating on its first and refunding mortgage bonds was raised to Aa3, from A1, by Moody's Investors Service, which also raised Duke's rating on a proposed shelf registration of preferred stock and the company's outstanding preferred stock issues to Aa3, from A1. Moody's said the upgrading was ''the result of reduced construction expenditures, a more manageable financing program, steadily improving measures of debt protection and fair regulation in all jurisdictions.''

title: GILBERT ASSOCIATES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Year-ago results include a gain equal to 9 cents a share from the sale of some operations.

title: COLGATE-PALMOLIVE CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including a nonrecurring gain of $11.7 million, or 14 cents a share, from the sale of the plastic food bag line in the United States and a charge of $4.5 million from foreign currency translations. c-After a foreign currency translation charge of $1.6 million.

title: ROLLAND INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss.

title: Iran Reports Sinking An Iraqi Gunboat
description: Iranian forces sank an Iraqi gunboat in the Persian Gulf today when it tried to make another attack on the Nowruz offshore oilfield, the official Iranian press agency reported.

title: AN ANCESTOR OF WHALES APPEARS TO HAVE WALKED
description: IT is hard to imagine a whale that walks, but three paleontologists believe they have identified such a transitional stage between land mammals and the cetaceans - mammalian dwellers of the deep sea.

title: MERCHANTS SAVINGS BANK (MANCHESTER, NH) reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss

title: DR. MEAD'S FIRST HUSBAND COMES TO HER DEFENSE
description: A new public debate over the validity of Margaret Mead's work has been spurred in recent months by the publication of ''Margaret Mead and Samoa - The Making and Unmaking of an Anthropological Myth'' by the Australian anthropologist Derek Freeman. Here, her first husband comes to her defense.

title: No Headline
description: Transactions BASEBALL CINCINNATI (NL) - Activated Char- l ie Puleo, pitcher. Sent Kelly Paris, in- f ielder, to Indianapolis of American As- s ociation.

title: GIVE CANADA AN EAR
description: The meeting between Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and President Reagan in Washington last week produced a meeting of minds on American strategic arms policy that will enhance the likelihood of Canada's allowing the United States to flight test cruise missiles over Canadian territory. This appears to resolve an important dispute between the two countries, but others remain, posing a threat to North American solidarity.

title: TIDEWATER'S TROUBLED FLEET
description: From a 24th-floor office window here, John P. LaBorde looked out over the city that has become the base for a large segment of the nation's offshore oil industry.

title: FURTHER MEASURES TO CURB DRUNKEN DRIVING STUDIED IN ALBANY
description: Three years after the State Legislature began to enact a number of laws intended to curb drunken driving, it is considering additional measures with the same goal.

title: SOVIET INTENTIONS
description: In the heated controversy over emplacement of intermediate-range nuclear missiles in Western Europe, one simple but crucial question seems never to be asked: Why did the Soviet Union provoke the controversy by deploying several hundred of its intermediate-range missiles, each with three nuclear warheads?

title: LEONARD DOWNS YANKEES
description: The Kansas City Royals needed only 12 innings to figure out Bob Shirley. It took Dennis Leonard five years to solve the Yankees.

title: MID PACIFIC AIRLINES reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss

title: NEW HUMANITIES SCHOOL TO SAIL AGAINST THE TIDE
description: AT a time when all eyes are on science and technology, a small group of independent planners in New York City's public high school headquarters is starting a new High School for the Humanities.

title: MILLER, H, & SONS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: The share earnings are adjusted for a 2-for-1 stock split paid in March 1983.

title: RAIDERS ATTEMPT TO FILE NEW SUIT
description: The Los Angeles Raiders, who won more than $34 million three weeks ago from the National Football League in antitrust damages, attempted to file another lawsuit yesterday against the league, charging it with obstruction of justice in the antitrust case.

title: NARDA MICROWAVE CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After tax credits of $1,146,000 for the quarter and $1,200,000 for the 9 months. c-Net income The net losses also include an adjustment on $1,064,000 which was made during the fiscal 1983 third quarter to record writedowns of inventories to net realizable values and an accrued loss on sales commitments.

title: Sparkman Energy
description: The Sparkman Energy Corporation of Corpus Christi, Tex., said directors had agreed to a spinoff of the company's oil and gas exploration and production operations.

title: CHINESE TRYING TO UNDO DAMAGE IN TIBET
description: When the snows vanish from Tibet's high valleys, the farmers yoke their shaggy yaks to wooden plows that break open the hard brown earth. Colored cockades and even red flags adorn the worn yokes of the plodding yaks in celebration that the spring planting has arrived.

title: MIDLAND SOUTHWEST CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net income

title: LAWMAKERS VOW TO BLOCK THE MX UNLESS REAGAN BACKS ARMS LIMITS
description: Three influential Senators said today that they had written to President Reagan to say they would not vote for deployment of the MX missile unless his Administration adopted a new and more flexible approach to arms control.

title: POLAND'S INSULT TO A JEWISH OBSERVANCE
description: To the Editor:

title: COMMITTEE OF 5 DRAFTED ARMS LETTER
description: The proposed pastoral letter on nuclear arms by the nation's Roman Catholic bishops is the handiwork of a five-member ad hoc committee on war and peace that has worked on the document for 22 months.

title: Spanish Priest Sentenced In '82 Attack on Pope
description: A Spanish priest who tried to assassinate Pope John Paul II with a bayonet a year ago was sentenced today to six and a half years in prison by judges whom he denounced as Communist murderers. The priest, the Rev. Juan Maria Fernandez Krohn, 33 years old, was given an additional seven-month prison term for insulting the court.

title: INTEGRATED SOFTWARE SYSTEMS CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
BRINK'S INFORMANT CITES CRIME GROUP
description: A key informant testified yesterday in the Federal Brink's trial in Manhattan that he had taken part in several armed robberies and a prison escape, all carried out by a group called ''the Family.''

title: MICKELBERRY CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Includes the results of Cunningham & Walsh Inc., acquired as of March 22, 1982, and accounted for as a purchase beginning in the second quarter of 1982.

title: 2 Ex-Knicks Are Honored
description: They played together and roomed together on the Knicks' championship teams of the early 1970's. Today, Bill Bradley and Dave DeBusschere were inducted into the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame together.

title: Molina Captures Triathlon Event
description: Scott Molina of Del Mar, Calif., won the men's division of the Ricoh Ironman United States triathlon championships Sunday.

title: NOTES ON FASHION
description: WHAT made Calvin Klein's fall collection so satisfying? What exactlyw as so great about those simple coats, plaid jackets and s traightlegged trousers?

title: FACTORY ORDERS UP STRONG 3.2%
description: Orders to factories for new manufactured goods rose a strong 3.2 percent in March, reaching the highest dollar total since the summer of 1981, Government figures showed today.

title: VW Shutdown in U.S.
description: Volkswagen of America said today that it was closing its assembly plant in Westmoreland County and furloughing 2,000 workers for a week because of low sales of the Rabbit model cars. The plant had been producing 470 vehicles a day compared with 1,105 in early 1981.

title: MICOM SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
DRAMATISTS GUILD SUES GROUP OF STAGE OWNERS
description: The Dramatists Guild, which has been sued for alleged antitrust violations by the League of New York Theaters and Producers, has filed a counterclaim, charging the league and its leaders with antitrust violations themselves.

title: MRS. KIRKPATRICK REJECTS AWARDS
description: Jeane J. Kirkpatrick, the United States delegate to the United Nations, today rejected awards from Barnard and Smith colleges because they had provoked controversies on both campuses.

title: Business and the Law; Bankruptcy Courts' Scope
description: WHEN the Wilson Foods Corporation went into a bankruptcy court on April 22 to try to get out of its union contract, it was following the lead of some other companies that are using the bankruptcy system to deal with problems other than insolvency.

title: Dr. Harry Blumberg, 80, Dies; Former Professor of Hebrew
description: Dr. Harry Blumberg, a retired professor of Hebrew at Hunter College who wrote several Hebrew textbooks, died last Thursday at the University of Michigan Hospital in Ann Arbor. He was 80 years old and lived in Ann Arbor.

title: GAF Dissidents Claim Victory
description: Samuel J. Heyman, the dissident GAF Corporation shareholder, claimed an ''overwhelming victory'' yesterday in his proxy contest against the company's management and said that he had filed a suit in a Wilmington, Del., court to force GAF to close off stockholder voting.

title: STURM RUGER & CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
PITTSBURGH & WEST VIRGINIA RR reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
JEEP MAKER PLANS FACTORY IN PEKING
description: The American Motors Corporation expects to sign an agreement later this week with China to jointly produce Jeeps in Peking and export some of them to other nations in the Far East.

title: BRIEFING
description: Mrs. Luce in Washington

title: Market Place; Emerging Growth Funds
description: JACK W. VANDER VLIET is fond of saying that ''emerging growth is the hottest-selling product in the mutual fund business.'' As chief investment oficer of Dean Witter Reynolds Intercapital Inc., the asset management arm of Dean Witter, he can speak from experience.

title: An Ohio Housing Issue Of $300 Million Offered
description: A $300 million bond issue of the Ohio Housing Finance Authority was tentatively offered with a maximum yield of 9.43 percent for bonds due in 2013, through underwriters led by Lehman Brothers Kuhn Loeb.

title: Topics; The Federal Hand; School Syllogism
description: Today's quiz concerns the syllogism. It is a type of deductive reasoning that can be valid (''All humans are mortal; all politicians are human; therefore all politicians are mortal'') or invalid (''Every pig is an animal; every man is an animal.

title: Nicaragua Slaying Protested
description: About 25 West Germans occupied their country's embassy here today to press for an investigation into the death of a West German doctor killed in fighting near the border with Honduras. The West Germans, who call themselves the German Internationalists, work as volunteers for the Sandinist Government. The slain doctor, Albrecht Georg Pflaum, was a member of the group.

title: Salary Caps On 5 Teams
description: In the recent negotiated settlement between the National Basketball Association and the National Basketball Players Association, salary caps were placed on the five teams with the highest payrolls this season, the Knicks and the Nets among them.

title: GI EXPORT CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including tax credits of $212,000 for the quarter and $620,000 for the 9 months. c-Including a tax credit of $51,000.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article Thursday on the deportation of people suspected of war crimes incorrectly reported the reason for Ivan John Demjanjuk's loss of American citizenship. It resulted from misrepresentations on his visa application, relating to his activities during World War II.

title: JACKSON NATIONAL LIFE INSURANCE CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Share earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split in the form of a 50 percent stock dividend declared Jan. 25.

title: UNITED KENO HILL MINES LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: The company is listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange. The company's operations have been closed down this year. Metal revenue this year stems from a favorable adjustment on the final settlement of prior year's silver.

title: ROMAN CATHOLIC BISHOPS TOUGHEN STANCE AGAINST NUCLEAR WEAPONS
description: In a series of decisive votes on a proposed pastoral letter on the arms race, the nation's Roman Catholic bishops today toughened their stand against nuclear weapons and appeared to separate themselves further from Reagan Administration military policies.

title: ATLAS CONSOLIDATED MINING & DEVELOPMENT CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including a tax credit of $2,115,000. c-Net loss.

title: ALLEN AFFLICTED BY STRESS
description: Doctors at an alcohol-treatment center determined yesterday that the Mets' Neil Allen was suffering from an emotional ''stress reaction'' resulting from his recent poor pitching, and not from alcoholic dependency as Allen had feared.

title: Need to Treat Alcoholism
description: Any treatment of alcoholism appears to be better for the average alcoholic than no treatment, a recent study done for the Office of Technology Assessment, a research arm of Congress, has concluded.

title: PERSSON IS HOPING TO RETURN
description: Stefan Persson skated off the ice and clomped into the trainer's room today while his Islander teammates continued their practice at Cantiague Rink. He flopped on a bench as Ron Waske, the trainer, rewound the straps that had slipped on his cumbersome leg brace.

title: Antitrust Pact On Plan by GTE
description: The GTE Corporation, the nation's secondlargest telephone company, disclosed a proposed antitrust settlement with the Justice Department that would allow it to buy the Southern Pacific Communications Company and thereby acquire its own longdistance operation.

title: Olivetti's Net Up in '82
description: Ing. C. Olivetti, the maker of office equipment, said today that the net income of its parent company rose by 7.2 percent, to the equivalent of $64.2 million in 1982 from $59.9 million in 1981. Revenues climbed to $1.06 billion from $930 million. Olivetti said it would report that consolidated group net profit rose to $70 million from $65.2 million and that revenues climbed by 15.7 percent.

title: DEAN OF BLACK MAYORS FACES HARD PRIMARY TODAY
description: Mayor Richard G. Hatcher, dean of the nation's black mayors after 16 years in office, is facing the toughest reelection battle of his career in Tuesday's Democratic Party primary.

title: Federico Alessandrini, Ex-Vatican Spokesman
description: Federico Alessandrini, a Roman Catholic journalist who was a former director of the Vatican's press office and deputy director of the Vatican's newspaper, died yesterday at his home in Rome. He was 77 years old.

title: The U.N. Today; May 3, 1983; GENERAL ASSEMBLY
description: Special Committee on the Charter of the United Nations and on the Strengthening of the Role of the Or- ganization - 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: Tenneco Restricts 'Old Gas' Buying
description: Tenneco Inc. said it had told its natural gas suppliers that it would no longer accept gas that is from wells drilled before 1977 and that costs more than 110 percent of the price of No.2 heating oil.

title: VINTAGE ANSWER TO A CURRENT QUESTION
description: To the Editor:

title: CONSTITUENTS PROMPT L.I. LEGISLATOR'S SALVADOR TRIP
description: Representative William Carney, Republican of Suffolk County, was surprised recently when 100 of his constituents added strident postscripts to a routine questionnaire he had mailed to his district. The postscripts opposed the Reagan Administration's policy in Central America.

title: GDV INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: GDV Inc. is a 98.7 percent owned subsidiary of City Investing Co.

title: Michelin Tire Leaving Lefton
description: The Michelin Tire Corporation is splitting with the Al Paul Lefton Company, its first American ad agency, after more than a decade, because Lefton cannot supply marketing help in a number of international markets where Michelin needs it.

title: STAR QUARTERBACK IN HALL OF FAME
description: Norm Van Brocklin, the quarterback of two National Football League championship teams who later became a coach and was inducted into professional football's Hall of Fame, died today of a heart attack. He was 57 years old and resided in Social Circle, a small town 35 miles east of here. He had been ill in recent years.

title: CANADIAN OCCIDENTAL PETROLEUM LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Britain Sees Oil Boom
description: Britain's North Sea oil and gas industry is preparing for a boom, the Energy Minister of State, Hamish Gray, said today in a speech prepared for delivery in the United States. According to a text of the speech released in London, he said optimism in the industry is based on the response by oil companies to recent budget measures designed to encourage development of marginal fields. Mr. Gray said Britain has laid the foundation for exporting offshore technology based on its North Sea experience to the United States and other countries.

title: RSC INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to April 3.
A.T.& T. Satellite
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company formally asked permission of the Federal Communications Commission to launch the first in a series of new Telstar satellites on July 28, the launching date assigned by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. The company plans to launch the second Telstar next year and a third in 1985. The Telstar series will augment and eventually replace the Comstar satellites that A.T.& T. leases now from the Communications Satellite Corporation, or Comsat.

title: PURITAN FASHIONS CORP reports earnings for qtr to April 1.
TV: 'ROTHKO CONSPIRACY,' A MOVIE
description: WOULDN'T it make a marvelous script? Beset by paranoia and depression in the last years of his life, and estranged from his wife and children, a celebrated painter is found dead in his studio, presumably a suicide, his arms slashed in the crooks of the elbows.

title: BUILDING OUTLAYS DROP 1.6%
description: Spending for new construction fell 1.6 percent in March despite new gains for the housing industry, the Commerce Department said today.

title: CORRECTION
description: A picture caption in the Arts and Leisure section Sunday announcing the date of the debut of the Alvin Ailey Dance Theater's ''Seven Journeys'' was incorrect. The work will be performed tonight at City Center.

title: RYAN DEFEATS METS BY 3-2, BUT IS HURT
description: The Mets got nine hits off Nolan Ryan last night, and Mike Torrez hurled a fine game against the Houston Astros. And still the Mets lost.

title: TEST FIRING OF ERRANT SATELLITE'S ROCKET REPORTED
description: SPACE agency engineers said they were ''very satisfied'' with the rocket-firing tests conducted yesterday in their efforts to save the $100 million communication satellite that went into the wrong orbit after its deployment last month by the space shuttle Challenger.

title: GREENWOOD RESOURCES LTD reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
description: b-Including a gain of $26,000 on the sale of oil and gas properties. c-Net income including a gain of $258,000 on the sale of oil and gas properties.

title: T-BAR INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
50 Feared Lost in Peru Flood
description: More than 50 people were feared dead after a flash flood swept over a bridge on the Pan-American Highway in northern Peru, the police said today. At least eight vehicles, including a bus, fell into the River Chaman after flood waters carrying trees and rocks poured over the bridge three miles from Chepen, 435 miles north of Lima, on Saturday night.

title: SYRIA FIGHTS ISRAELI PULLOUT TERMS
description: President Hafez al-Assad of Syria said today that the terms Israel was demanding for withdrawing from Lebanon were unacceptable and urged the Lebanese Government to continue to reject them.

title: Cheating On SALT
description: Hard-liners are demanding that President Reagan denounce what they see as a clear Soviet violation of SALT II. But close examination raises the question whether Mr. Reagan's own hands are clean enough to justify such outrage.

title: GREAT LAKES INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Umpires Strike Back
description: Richie Phillips, the attorney for the Major League Umpires Association, warned yesterday that teams persisting in showing controversial plays on scoreboards would risk forfeiting games. ''The association has informed the clubs it is opposed to showing controversial plays,'' he said.

title: Konica Picks Levine
description: Levine, Huntley, Schmidt & Beaver will be the agency for the introduction of Konica's new audiotapes and videotapes, which will be backed by more than $1 million in advertising. Konica is the marketing arm of the Konishiroku Foto Industry Company, Tokyo. This will be its first entry into audio tapes and videotapes.

title: TRANSCO ENERGY CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
HARVEY GROUP INC reports earnings for qtr to Jan 29.
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $708,358 for the quarter and $1,704,358 for the year, losses on the disposal of discontinued operations of $762,213 for the quarter and $1,883,213 for the year and extraordinary charges of $7,200 for the quarter and $118,800 for the year. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $456,668 for the quarter and $1,861,558 for the year.

title: TELEX CORP reports earnings for year to March 31.
description: b-Includes an extraordinary gain of $4,213,000 from equity to debt changes.

title: MOLECULAR GENETICS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
MESSAGE TO THE G.O.P. FROM OLDER WOMEN
description: To the Editor:

title: FELMONT OIL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
CAMFLO MINES LTD reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
description: b-Net loss after losses of $33,565,000 from discontinued operations and writedowns.

title: MCA INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
COMMUNITY NATIONAL BANK (BROOKLYN, NY) reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
REEVES COMMUNICATIONS CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
People
description: * Richard B. Hamilton Jr. promoted to senior vice president at Benton & Bowles.

title: JEFFERSON-PILOT CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Chautauqua Area Ripped by Twister
description: A twister leveled homes in Chautauqua County late this afternoon and killed two people, according to county sheriff's deputies.

title: PRATT-READ CORP reports earnings for qtr to April 3.
SOME BAD SIGNALS FOR U.S.F.L.
description: H alfway into its first season, the United States Football League has emerged with some regional television roots but with little apparent strength on the national level.

title: LIQUID AIR CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Charge Is Made Against Coach
description: A Pennsylvania high school football coach claims a former Clemson University assistant coach offered him a coaching job five years ago if he would persuade the star lineman Jimbo Covert to go to school there.

title: SOUTHERN CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Includes an accounting adjustment credit of $23,000,000.

title: OLE MISS HEEDS A CALL BY BLACKS TO FURL REBEL FLAG
description: In 1962 the University of Mississippi was forced to open its doors to black students. Now, with some prodding and a little turmoil, it has thrown open a window or two and thrown out the Confederate flag as its unofficial symbol.

title: JAPAN-FORD STEEL TALKS COLLAPSE
description: The Ford Motor Company said today that negotiations to sell a majority interest in its Rouge Steel subsidiary to a group of Japanese companies headed by Nippon Kokan K.K. had collapsed because of labor issues.

title: Spanish Yellow Pages Is Mailed to 300,000
description: The New York Telephone Company mailed out 300,000 copies of its Spanish Yellow Pages - Paginas Amarillas Para La Communidad Hispana -to customers in New York City, Westchester and Rockland Counties and on Long Island yesterday.

title: INTERNATIONAL SHIPHOLDING CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss.

title: Soviet Six Captures 19th World Crown
description: The Soviet Union routed Team Canada today, 8-2, in the final game of the world hockey championship and gained its 19th world title.

title: PRODUCTION OPERATORS CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: The year-ago net in both periods include $908,000 gain on sale of securities.

title: Analyst in Spotlight At Morgan Stanley
description: Barton M. Biggs voiced his opinion on the stock market yesterday, and the market apparently took his view into consideration. Mr. Biggs, who is in charge of investment management and strategy at the prestigious Morgan Stanley & Company, put the word out at a morning meeting at Morgan that he thought the market had got ahead of itself.

title: DAVID PUTNAM, A FORCE IN INTERNATIONAL FILMS
description: HOLLYWOOD By rights, a movie producer who says that ''films must transcend profit and loss,'' speaks passionately of ''movies and moral values'' and adds, ''Bringing E.T. back to life was a terrible thing to do to kids,'' shouldn't expect to make money.

title: MINTER RESIGNS AS DEPUTY CITY SCHOOLS CHANCELLOR
description: Dr. Thomas K. Minter, who was among the leading contenders for the post of New York City Schools Chancellor, yesterday announced his resignation as deputy chancellor for instruction.

title: BALLET: ABT OPENS WITH 'SYMPHONIE'
description: week season last night at the Metropolitan Opera House with the company's first performance in New York of a ''lost'' masterpiece by George Balanchine.

title: Brooke Shields Going to Princeton
description: Brooke Shields, the actress and teenage model, will be one of 1,100 freshmen to enter Princeton University this fall, Princeton announced today.

title: HURDLES TO A SOLUTION OF MIDEAST ISSUES
description: To the Editor:

title: INTERNATIONAL GAME TECHNOLOGY CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
52 Deaths Reported Linked to Church Policy
description: Fifty-two people, including 28 babies and seven other children, died over nine years while they or their parents followed the teachings of a church that instructs its members to avoid doctors, The Fort Wayne News-Sentinel reported today.

title: INVESTIGATORS STILL BAFFLED BY MYSTERY COLLEGE PROFESSOR
description: When prosecutors in Pennsylvania face Paul Arthur Crafton in court today, a month and a half after his arrest, they will still not have any idea why he may have used two aliases to teach simultaneously at different colleges. Nor will they know why he had credit cards and international correspondence in a dozen names.

title: PROTECTIVE CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
S.& P. Rating For SmithKline
description: Standard & Poor's gave a preliminary AA-plus rating yesterday to SmithKline's $250 million of debt securities being issued under the shelf registration rule.

title: Arafat Denounces Shultz Trip And Warns of 'Israeli Threats'
description: Yasir Arafat, leader of the Palestine Liberation Organization, said today that Secretary of State George P. Shultz was in the Middle East to promote ''imperialist schemes'' against the Arab world.

title: Loss at Tiger International
description: Tiger International said its loss widened in the first quarter, to $50.8 million, from $24 million in the first quarter of last year.

title: ONE DEATH REPORTED AMONG POLISH MARCHERS
description: At least one death was reported today in Sunday's anti-Government demonstrations in at least 20 cities. A young man was said to have died in Nowa Huta as tens of thousands of Solidarity supporters across the country defied the police to hold May Day rallies.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Proposal to Honor George Balanchine

title: MOSELEY, HALLGARTEN, ESTABROOK & WEEDEN HOLDING CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss after losses from discontinued operations of $1.5 million for the quarter and $2.9 million for the year. c-After income from discontinued operations of $1,052,000 and atax credit of $789,000.

title: ADOBE OIL & GAS CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
BIW CABLE SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
News Analysis
description: It is a measure of President Reagan's political troubles with Congress that as the Republican-controlled Senate opened its debate on the 1984 budget today, no one was out front advocating the Reagan budget.

title: PARALLEL PETROLEUM reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss

title: JUSTICES OVERTURN VAGRANCY LAW REQUIRING IDENTIFICATION FOR POLICE
description: The Supreme Court ruled today that a state cannot give a police officer the discretion to arrest a person who fails to identify himself to the officer's satisfaction.

title: Basketball Camp For Star-Gazers
description: In early February, a company called The All-Star Baseball School ran a weeklong camp in Scottsdale, Ariz., for men 35 years or older who were willing to pay $2,495 to spend a week taking instruction from eight or nine members of the 1969 Chicago Cubs. More than 60 men took advantage of the opportunity.

title: STANG HYDRONICS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: WINSTON MILLS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Includes a tax benefit of $497,000. c-Net loss. Winston Mills is 56 percent owned by Puritan Fashions Corp.

title: Fire Hits Home Of Arthur Miller
description: A fire this morning heavily damaged the home of Arthur Miller, the writer. Mr. Miller and his wife, Inge Morath, were not in the house on Toplet Road when the fire started, at about 9 A.M.

title: ISSUES ARE SCARCE IN SAN DIEGO MAYORAL RACE
description: Voters here will choose between a moderate Republican and a conservative Democrat in an election for mayor Tuesday. The candidates agree more than they disagree on the things San Diegans say are important to them now, such as carefully monitoring growth and adding new jobs to an economy that has been through a bad year.

title: ASSOCIATED HOSTS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
LEE DATA CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Stock Index Contracts Fall Less Than Market
description: As expected, stock index futures prices declined along with the market yesterday. But all three index futures posted much smaller losses than any of the market averages. Many brokers took this to mean that the sharp stock market decline might have been overdone.

title: CLERC IS UPSET BY DIBBS
description: Strange things happen to Eddie Dibbs at Forest Hills. During the United States Open one year, a spectator in the stands at the West Side Tennis Club was struck by a stray bullet while Dibbs played John McEnroe. In 1981, Dibbs won the Tournament of Champions. Last year, he upset the top-seeded McEnroe in the event before losing to Ivan Lendl in the final.

title: INTERTHERM INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
U.S. Steel's Chairman Defends Import Plan
description: David Roderick, chairman of the United States Steel Corporation, today strongly defended the company's decision to import semifinished steel slabs from the British Steel Corporation for processing at its Fairless Works near Philadelphia.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''We will all want to reflect on the events surrounding this episode, and what they tell us about who we are and what we have become.'' - Jeane J. Kirkpatrick, on her rejection of awards from Barnard and Smith colleges. (A2:3.)

title: A Safer Glove
description: The New York State Athletic Commission, which in January 1982 made thumbless boxing gloves mandatory for all four-, six- and eight-round bouts, recently completed a study of changes involving use of the new glove. James Moogan, an assistant to the commission, compared 410 bouts with thumbed gloves in 1981 to 325 bouts with thumbless gloves in 1982.

title: DATA CARD CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 26.
description: b-Including income from discontinued operations of $67,000 for the quarter and $446,000 for the year. c-Net loss after losses from discontinued operations of $4,886,000 for the quarter and $5,345,000 for the year.

title: ALPHA INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Share earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split in the form of a dividend distributed Dec. 13, 1982.

title: HOGAN SYSTEMS reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
CANBRA FOODS reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
ALLEN'S BIG STRUGGLE IS WAGED WITHIN
description: A long time ago, Herb Norman promised himself that he would never again become close with a baseball player. Norman is the equipment manager of the Mets. He has watched the faces come and go from the beginning of the franchise, 21 years ago, and he decided that it was not healthy to share the sadness of each departure. All Norman had to do was remember the pain he felt when Jim Hickman, his friend, was traded. He preferred to just smile and go about his work.

title: THE DEMOCRACY BORN OF A CARIBBEAN CRISIS
description: To the Editor:

title: BALDWIN HALTS SALE OF 2 INVESTING PLANS
description: The Baldwin-United Corporation said it had ''voluntarily suspended'' sales of two major investment products pending a review of its financial condition by state insurance regulators.

title: I.C.C. Rail Deregulation
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission, over the strong objections of its chairman, decided today to deregulate freight shipments by railroad boxcars. The I.C.C. had tentatively made the decision previously.

title: CITY ACTS TO END DECEPTIVE SALES IN TOURIST STORES
description: The New York City Department of Consumer Affairs served summonses yesterday on 18 midtown stores that it said had used ''deceptive practices'' to sell audio and video equipment, cameras, calculators and Oriental rugs.

title: CALUMET INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net income Shares outstanding have been restated to reflect a 3 percent stock dividend distributed March 1, 1982.

title: S.E.C. SAYS FINANCIAL CORP. WILL LOWER '82 PROFIT REPORT
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission said today that the Financial Corporation of America had agreed to reduce its previously reported 1982 profits 26 percent, to $27.2 million, from $36.7 million.

title: AERO SERVICES INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
NUI CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
OLSTEN CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
PARK ELECTROCHEMICAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to Feb 27.
KNUDSEN CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including a gain of $873,000, or 32 cents a share, on the sale of real estate.

title: ANOTHER SWITCH ON HITLER 'DIARIES'
description: A British historian who had challenged the authenticity of the purported Hitler diaries has changed his mind, The Times of London said today.

title: JUSTICE HOLMES'S 1935 BEQUEST REMAINS UNFULFILLED
description: When Oliver Wendell Holmes died in 1935, he left the bulk of his estate, more than $260,000, to the United States Government. It was the largest unrestricted gift ever made to the American people, and shortly thereafter President Roosevelt called on Congress to devote Holmes's ''noble bequest'' to ''some purpose worthy of the great man who gave it.''

title: Wasting the Courts' Precious Time
description: Though starved for resources, New York City's overflowing criminal courts lavish time upon lawyers who question prospective jurors. A bill to curtail this abuse - one-third of trial time is spent picking juries - comes before the Codes Committee of the State Legislature in Albany today.

title: ALLEGHENY BEVERAGE CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
CROWN INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including a gain of $216,000 for the quarter and 6 months from the sale of securities. c-Net loss.

title: CCL INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
AMERICAN WOMAN WILL HEAD OFFICE OF U.N. IN WASHINGTON
description: In a long career in public relations, Phyllis Kaminsky has promoted the casino in Monaco, helped gather Jewish votes for Ronald Reagan and served as the chief press officer for the United States Information Agency.

title: OCCIDENTAL PETROLEUM CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After loss on discontinued operations of $8.6 million. There were no share earnings in latest quarter because net income did not cover preferred dividend requirements.

title: Q&A
description: Q. Why do your muscles feel sore the day after an unusually strenuous exercise?

title: KNICKS START LOOKING TO NEXT SEASON
description: While the Knicks gather at noon today at Madison Square Garden to say their goodbyes, the front office is beginning the process of working toward next season. Where spending money on the free agent market once was viewed as a quick solution, the Knicks will now focus on planning.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Services With Smiles

title: THE RETURN OF THE BARBER
description: H e is 66 years old now, but wherever he went in midtown over the weekend people would stare at that familiar face for a moment and then put his name with it. Sal Maglie.

title: NASDAQ'S NEW PROMINENCE
description: The over-the-counter market, once considered a sideshow in stock trading, is gaining new prominence. Advances in electronic trading, combined with the O-T-C market's multiple market makers, low entry cost and lack of red tape have helped it become the trading forum of choice among high growth companies.

title: TUESDAY SPORTS
description: Baseball Mets vs. Houston Astros, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadows, Queens, 7:35 P.M. The Mets, having had trouble with Phil Niekro of the Braves on Sunday, face his brother Joe tonight. (Television - Channel 9, 7:30 P.M. Radio -WHN, 1050; 7:30 P.M.) Yankees vs. Royals, at Kansas City, Mo. Doyle Alexander, with an earned run average of 7.02, tries for his first victory of the season. Paul Splittorff starts for the Royals. (Television - Channel 11, 8:30 P.M. Radio - WABC, 770; 8:30 P.M.) Basketball Los Angeles Lakers vs. Portland Trail Blazers, Western Conference semifinal, fifth game, at Inglewood, Calif. Portland averted a sweep Sunday, but no team in the history of the National Basketball Association has ever won a playoff series after trailing by 3-0. (Television - ESPN, 10:30 P.M.) Hockey Islanders vs. Boston Bruins, Prince of Wales Conference final, fourth game, at Nassau Coliseum, Uniondale, L.I., 8:05 P.M. A victory would put the Islanders in a commanding 3-1 position for the return to Boston on Thursday. (Television - Sports@Channel, 8 P.M. Radio - WMCA, 570; WGBB, 1240; WALK-FM, 97.5; 8 P.M.) Black Hawks vs. Edmonton Oilers, Clarence Campbell Conference final, fourth game, at Chicago. Wayne Gretzky and the high-scoring Oilers go for a sweep. (Television - USA Cable, 8:30 P.M.) Tennis Mercedes Tournament of Champions, at the West Side Tennis Club, Forest Hills, Queens, noon.

FAMILY ENTERTAINMENT CENTERS reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
