EMONS INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including an extraordinary credit of $437,534 for the quarter and 9 months. c-Including an extraordinary credit of $869,258.

title: 21.87 DROP PUTS DOW AT 1,204.33
description: Stock prices plunged yesterday after a leading Wall Street investment firm told clients that it had switched from a bullish viewpoint to a cautious one concerning the market's short-term outlook.

title: 2 Killed and 9 Hurt In Thruway Crash
description: Two residents of the Bronx were killed and nine other people were injured in a head-on crash of a station wagon and a pickup truck on the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway near here this morning, the state police said.

title: NU-WEST GROUP LTD reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
description: b-Includes writedowns of $72.3 million and $66.3 million as its share of a loss of Carma Ltd., its 48.4 percent owned affiliate. c-Net income

title: WRITER CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Share earnings reflect a 100 percent stock dividend paid Dec. 31.

title: Hunts Join Dissent At Louisiana Land
description: The Hunt family of Texas disclosed yesterday that it would vote its 12.4 percent stock interest in the Louisiana Land and Exploration Company in favor of Delo H. Caspary, head of a dissident group of investors. Mr. Caspary, of Rockport, Tex., hopes to oust the oil company's present management.

title: FORD MOTOR CREDIT CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Ford Motor Credit is the financing division of Ford Motor Co.

title: S.A.L. CABLE COMMUNICATIONS INC reports earnings for year to Jan 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: FREE MAILING PRIVILEGE FOR CONGRESS IS UPHELD
description: The Supreme Court today upheld the constitutionality of the Congressional franking privilege. In a one-sentence order issued without a written opinion, the Court affirmed a ruling by a Federal District Court here that the free mailing privilege does not operate as an impermissible Federal subsidy of the re-election campaigns of incumbent members of Congress.

title: RAILROAD PASSES FOR SOME RIDERS ARE NOT MAILED
description: Some railroad commuters felt an aftershock today of the recent Metro-North Commuter Railroad strike: their May commutation tickets had failed to arrive in the mail.

title: Women's Bank Bid Withdrawn
description: Brasilinvest S.A. Investimentos Participa,coes e Negocios, a Brazilian banking corporation, said it had withdrawn its offer for shares of the First Women's Bank of New York because of undersubscription of the tender offer.

title: Worker Is Killed In 33-Story Fall
description: A construction worker was killed yesterday morning when he fell 33 stories from scaffolding on an apartment building on the East Side of Manhattan, the police said.

title: STAGE: 'THE RITZ,' FARCE
description: HAVING already served as a hit Broadway comedy and a less successful Richard Lester movie, Terrence McNally's bathhouse farce, ''The Ritz,'' now has a third life, in a manner of speaking, as disco theater. The play opened last night at Xenon. In a season in which several theaters have been transformed into arenas, a show at Xenon reverses the procedure, turning a disco back into a theater. On the still existing proscenium arch, behind the flashing neon, lurks the ghost of the old Henry Miller's Theater.

title: IOWA-ILLINOIS GAS & ELECTRIC CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
TYLAN CORP reports earnings for qtr to April 2.
Nu-West Cites Deficit for '82
description: Nu-West Group Ltd., a Calgary, Alberta, real estate developer, today announced a large loss for 1982 and said it and its lenders had agreed that Nu-West would stop making interest and principal payments on $562 million of loans.

title: Dome Extensions
description: Dome Petroleum Ltd. said lenders agreed to further extensions of Dome's payments of principal under various loan pacts. The payments, due today, were extended to May 31 for certain foreign lenders and to June 1 for Canadian banks.

title: Bunting Joins Thrift Unit
description: John R. Bunting, who once headed one of the nation's major banks, has been named president and chief executive officer of the Tri-County Savings and Loan Association, a small South Jersey organization with assets of about $35 million.

title: GRADUATE APPLICATIONS RISE
description: PAUL J. Contino graduated from the State University of New York at Binghamton two years ago and took an $18,000-a-year job at a bank. Finding the work ''too cut and dry,'' he quit to teach in a parochial high school for a year and has now decided to enroll at the University of Notre Dame to get his Ph.D. in English.

title: CONVERGENT TECHNOLOGIES reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
DID LUCY ACTUALLY STAND ON HER OWN TWO FEET?
description: THE debate over whether the primate Lucy actually stood up on two feet three million years ago and walked - thus becoming one of mankind's most important ancestors - has evolved into two interpretive viewpoints, three family trees, spats over four scientific techniques and too many personality clashes to count.

title: MARGIOTTA APPEAL IS DENIED HEARING BY SUPREME COURT
description: The United States Supreme Court declined yesterday to hear an appeal by Joseph M. Margiotta of his 1981 conviction for extortion and mail fraud. The refusal meant that he must begin serving a twoyear prison sentence within two weeks, and that he must step down as the Republican leader of Nassau County.

title: L.I. Exterminator Is Indicted
description: A Long Island exterminating concern and its president were indicted today on charges of misapplying a toxic pesticide that contaminated a home so badly it had to be razed.

title: SIKH HOLY LEADER TALKS OF VIOLENCE
description: Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale, who is considered a holy warrior by his followers, a fanatical preacher of violence by his adversaries, and the key figure in the Sikh uprising now flaring in the Punjab by many on both sides, looks as if he could have stepped right out of the ranks of Sikh warriors of another century.

title: DU PONT FALLS 18.8% IN QUARTER
description: E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company, citing gains by its chemicals operations, reported yesterday that first-quarter net income dropped 18.8 percent, while sales edged up 3.7 percent.

title: THE BASEBALL GUIDE TO CHARACTER AND POLITICS
description: It is commonly believed that loyalty to this baseball team or that is an accident - a random choice dictated by chance at an early age, an allegiance without content or political meaning. But where I grew up in East Flatbush in the late 40's and early 50's, we knew better.

title: Profits Scoreboard
Key Rates
description: * Maximum rate Salomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: ARGO PETROLEUM CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
WALBAR INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
SEX HORMONE LINKED TO HEART DISEASE, NEW STUDY FINDS
description: ANEW study with major implications has found evidence that men who have suffered heart attacks, the nation's leading killer, have more of a hormone called estradiol than men without heart disease.

title: HOME FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN (SAN DIEGO, CALIF reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After a charge of $2.8 million from prepayment penalties on Federal Home Loan Bank advances. c-Net loss. The company did not report earnings on a per share basis because it only converted to a stock association on April 7.

title: Charlotte Curtis; Hugh Casson On the Arts; 'In England, we concentrate on letters. We've not so many painters.''
description: BRITAIN'S esteemed Royal Academy of Fine Arts has allowed a bundle of its treasured paintings to visit these once colonial shores, and Sir Hugh Casson, the architect and the academy's eclectically imaginative president, was here in celebration. A wiry little man with wispy gray hair, big blue eyes and a passion for urban beauty, he believes in the propriety of sending art works off for exhibitions.

title: STABLE FROM LOUISIANA IS HITCHING ITS WAGON TO A LONG SHOT
description: A year ago, David Nelson expected to be selling tractors this week. He wasn't looking forward to it. Nelson, a horse-loving senior at Louisiana Tech, had enrolled in a race-track management course and taken an unsuccessful fling at training. But he was about to be graduated with a degree in agriculture and business, and it seemed time to take up a respectable calling. Tractors, he says, looked like his future.

title: Waste Unit Sale
description: Waste Management Inc. said a United States District Court had ordered it to sell a solid-waste hauling operation in Dallas.

title: JANNOCK LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: The company is listed on the Toronto and Montreal stock exchanges.

title: ALLEGHENY & WESTERN ENERGY CORP reports earnings for year to Feb 28.
FIRST WESTERN FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss.

title: The Police Blotter
description: A sniper fired four shots at two police officers writing parking summonses in front of 265 Cherry Street on the Lower East Side at about 5:40 A.M. yesterday. The officers, Frank Bose and Susan Cantatore, were not hit.

title: Sudan's Leader Re-elected
description: President Gaafar al-Nimeiry of the Sudan was re-elected to a third six-year term with 99.6 percent of the votes in a 12-day uncontested referendum last month, Egypt's Middle East News Agency reported.

title: NORTH ATLANTIC INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to April 2.
description: The share earnings reflect 3-for-2 stock split paid in February 1983. A public offering of 412,500 shares completed on April 12 is not reflected in first quarter results.

title: Bridge: New York Players Do Well As L.I. Regional Winds Up
description: New Yorkers dominated the final day's play of the Long Island Regional over the weekend in Hempstead. Marla Chaikin and Sam Guzzardo of New York, with Haskell and Linda Deutsch of Elizabeth, N.J., won the Flight A Swiss teams.

title: DAWSON GEOPHYSICAL CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Coast Newscaster Hired For 'Early Today' Spot
description: NBC has hired Connie Chung, a newscaster at KNXT-TV, the CBS station in Los Angeles, as an anchor of ''Early Today,'' the newscast that runs from 6 to 7 A.M, preceding the ''Today'' show.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: ALL ABOUT IRVING

title: PERU'S LEADER UNHURT IN SHOOTING
description: A guard accidentally fired his submachine gun into a crowd around President Fernando Belaunde Terry in the port city of Callao today, wounding three people, the Government said. President Belaunde was unhurt.

title: Leaving Wells for Bates
description: After 10 years as a creative team at Wells, Rich, Greene, near the dignified old Plaza Hotel, Thomas W. Heck, art director, and Nancy Vaughn, copywriter, are moving to Ted Bates Advertising/New York, in the midst of bustling, rowdy Times Square. They will be executive creative directors, reporting to Michael L. Becker, vice chairman and chief creative officer.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Graniteville Co. said it had urged shareholders to defer a decision on the recent bid by Southeastern Public Service Co.; the company said it was evaluating the offer and would provide an opinion by Monday.

title: Pabst Net Off; Stock Split Set
description: The Pabst Brewing Company said yesterday that first-quarter earnings fell 5.8 percent, to $1.47 million, or 20 cents a share, from $1.56 million, or 19 cents a share, a year ago. Revenues fell 8.8 percent, to $160.7 million, from $176.3 million.

title: NIAGARA MOHAWK POWER CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Hawaii Bond Yield At Maximum 8.8%
description: The Hawaii Department of Transportation's $118.1 million issue of A/ AAA-rated airport and harbor revenue bonds was tentatively priced with a maximum yield of about 8.80 percent through underwriters led by Blyth Eastman Paine Webber Inc. Yields for shorter maturities ranged from 4.75 percent in 1984 to 8.5 percent in 1997.

title: Atari Suit Filed by Mattel
description: Mattel Inc., the big toy maker, has charged that its rival, Atari Inc., lured three of its employees away and with their help developed game cartridges compatible with Mattel's Intellivision units.

title: JEFFERSON NATIONAL LIFE INSURANCE CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After loss from discontinued operations of $96,000 and capital gain of $8,000. c-After loss from discontinued operations of $27,000 and capital loss of $508,000.

title: YANKS ARE SLOPPY IN LOSS TO ROYALS
description: The futility that George Steinbrenner saw in the Yankees in Texas deepened tonight in Kansas City. Playing one of their sloppiest games of the season, the Yankees lost to the Royals, 5-2, and fell farther from the .500 level they have been unable to surpass.

title: TEXAS INTERNATIONAL CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Includes a stock appreciation rights (SAR) credit of $66,000. c-Includes income of $538,000, or 3 cents a share, rom Regal International, a subsidiary was spun-off in May 1982, and an increase of $1,897,000, or 10 cents a share, as a result of stock appreciation rights credit to general and administrative expenses.

title: 49ers Accused Of Tampering
description: The Houston Oilers said today they had filed tampering charges against the San Francisco 49ers because of a newspaper column written by Bill Walsh, the 49ers' coach, regarding Earl Campbell.

title: TECHNOLOGY MARKETING reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $271,000. c-Net loss after a loss from discontinued operations of $580,000 for the quarter.

title: WHITE CONSOLIDATED INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Death of a Friend, Search for a Killer
description: Y esterday was the funeral of Richard Lilly, a 19-year-old student stabbed to death in Prospect Park in Brooklyn as he was returning from an afternoon baseball game last Thursday with three friends.

title: THE LIMITED BASIC MISSION OF 'FREEZE ENTHUSIASTS'
description: To the Editor:

title: Stocks Are Mixed; Dow Closes Up 3.68
description: A late rally enabled the stock market to finish mixed yesterday in continued active trading following Monday's selloff. The biggest gainers were some of the technology and precious metal issues.

title: SCOPE INC. reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After a loss of $139,000 from discontinued operations.

title: BOSSY SCORES 3 AS ISLANDERS ROUT BRUINS FOR 3-1 LEAD
description: The difference, on an individual basis, is Mike Bossy. The Bruins have no one like him. Collectively, however, there is a bigger difference between the Islanders and the Bruins. Depth. And the Islanders showed it again tonight, rolling to an 8-3 victory over Boston at Nassau Coliseum and opening up a 3-1 lead in their four-of-seven-game Wales Conference final series.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Avis Rent A Car System Inc., Garden City, L.I., appointed Robert D. Cardillo vice president-sales.

title: MICHIGAN GENERAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Includes an extraordinary credit of $404,000 from the recognition of net operating and capital loss carryforwards. c-Includes an extraordinary credit of $2,725,000 from the successful completion of an exchange offer of senior debentures in 1982.

title: No Headline
description: Required Reading Congratulations

title: James Schuyler Named Winner of Poets Award
description: James Schuyler has been named winner of the $10,000 Academy of American Poets Fellowship for ''distinguished poetic achievement.'' Mr. Schuyler, the author of three volumes of poetry and three novels, won the Pulitzer Prize in 1980 for his collection ''The Morning of the Poem.'' He is the 44th recipient of the fellowship, which had also been awarded to Robert Frost, William Carlos Williams, Ezra Pound, Marianne Moore and Elizabeth Bishop.

title: PERSONAL HEALTH
description: THE miles of tubing that make up the body's liquid-waste disposal system are supposed to be clear of objects that could obstruct the flow of urine. But each year millions of Americans develop such obstructions in the form of kidney stones.

title: Medical Month Is Due From Le Jacq in the Fall
description: Le Jacq Publishing, which already has a number of clinical journals for physicians, next is going to bring out a publication intended more to entertain than to instruct. However, the hope is that the advertisers will remain the same - the health-care and pharmaceutical crowd with their fat promotion budgets.

title: L.S.U. GIVEN $125 MILLION BY OILMAN
description: Louisiana State University has received a $125 million gift, said to be the largest ever made to an educational institution, from C.B. Pennington, an 83-year-old oil executive.

title: 3 DEAD AS TORNADOES STRIKE IN 11 COUNTIES IN UPSTATE NEW YORK
description: Tornadoes roared across 11 counties in western and central New York Monday evening, killing three people, injuring dozens more and damaging or destroying hundreds of homes, state officials said.

title: SHULTZ HOPES FOR ACCORD BY WEEKEND
description: Secretary of State George P. Shultz said today that he hoped to conclude an Israeli-Lebanese agreement on troop withdrawal by the end of the week, but he cautioned that some ''major problems'' remained.

title: RB INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: THE WISCONSIN FISH FRY: MATTER OF STATE
description: MIDDLETON, Wis. AROUND the country, thousands of restaurants probably hold Friday night fish fries, but Wisconsin has raised the meal to a matter of statewide identity.

title: PERU AND CHILE NEAR DEBT RESTRUCTURING
description: Two of Latin America's smaller debtor nations - Peru and Chile - appear to be moving closer to a restructuring of their foreign debt. Peru, which at the end of last year had $11 billion in outstanding debts, has completed a $770 million financing package with a consortium of its foreign banks. And Chile appears to be on the verge of reaching an agreement with its foreign creditors on restructuring at least part of its $17 billion debt.

title: Master's Advice
description: Jimmy Arias is only 18 years old, but his aggressive, feisty attitude already reminds many tennis fans of Jimmy Connors when Connors was younger.

title: BANKERS SPLIT OVER FED STAND
description: Two leading banking industry trade groups split today over a Federal Reserve Board's proposal that Congress impose a temporary moratorium on combinations of banking and non-banking companies.

title: Steel 'Dumping' Found
description: The Commerce Department has concluded that West German companies are ''dumping'' stainless steel products in the United States, a spokesman said today. The deparment, in a final determination, found that the West German companies were selling hot and cold rolled stainless sheet and strip in the United States at prices up to 7.76 percent lower than in their own country. The United States International Trade Commission has 45 days to make a final determination of harm.

title: GOODYEAR CANADA INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
OILERS TOP HAWKS AND SWEEP SERIES
description: The Edmonton Oilers defeated the Chicago Black Hawks, 6-3, tonight for a four-game sweep of their Campbell Conference final series.

title: Comecon Disputes Reported
description: A long-planned summit meeting of the Council for Mutual Economic Assistance, scheduled for this month, has been postponed indefinitely because of disputes within the group, East European sources said today.

title: TOWN SUPERVISOR DROPS WESTCHESTER CHALLENGE
description: Anthony Veteran, the Greenburgh Town Supervisor, withdrew today from the race for Westchester County Executive, leaving the Democratic field to Ogden R. Reid, a former six-term United States Representative.

title: Arab Is Killed in West Bank
description: An army spokesman said today that one Arab died and two Arabs and an Israeli were wounded in a clash Monday between West Bank villagers and Israeli border policemen. The conflict began when residents of the village of Kfar Biddiya tried to stop Israeli bulldozers preparing land for a Jewish settlement.

title: SHAKEN TOWN BEGINS HUGE CLEANUP
description: Many families live today in tents pitched in the front yards of houses no longer safe. Others sit on overstuffed chairs surrounded by bedroom furniture, brought outside for protection in case of continued aftershocks from the earthquake Monday afternoon that shattered this small town.

title: HOUSE PANEL BARS AID FOR THE C.I.A. AGAINST NICARAGUA
description: The House Select Committee on Intelligence, in a setback for the Reagan Administration, voted today to cut off funds for the Central Intelligence Agency to conduct covert military actions in Nicaragua.

title: COMMUNICATIONS CORP OF AMERICA reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: RAMBLER OIL reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
NICARAGUA REPORTS A NEW DRIVE BY GUERRILLAS
description: The Nicaraguan Government charged today that a new rebel force of 1,500 men had crossed its northern border with the active participation of the Honduran military.

title: INQUIRY INTO FANNIE MAE PRESSURE
description: A Senate housing subcommittee is investigating reports that the Federal National Mortgage Association, the nation's largest housing lender, has exerted undue influence on private companies to obtain support for a bill that would greatly expand the association's lending authority.

title: KERR ADDIS0N MINES LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: The company is listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange.

title: COLUMBIA GAS SYSTEM INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
A COMEBACK FOR THE BIG CAR
description: Early one evening last week at J & F Oldsmobile, along jampacked Route 440 in Jersey City, James and Arlene Brennan were doing something they had not done in 11 years. They were buying a car. And their choice was no compact but a big Delta 88, with a price tag of almost $12,000.

title: Key Rates
description: * Maximum RateSalomon Brothers estimates for bellweather issues

title: CLAMMING IT UP
description: Government's eternal yearning for an ill-informed citizenry is perfectly natural. As every businessman knows, it is very hard to cut a deal when everybody and his sister-in-law knows what you're up to. Government is the same way. Hence President Reagan's distaste for the Freedom of Information laws.

title: News Summary; WEDNESDAY, MAY 4, 1983
description: International A House committee vote cut off funds for the Central Intelligence Agency's covert military actions in Nicaragua, providing a setback for the Reagan Administration. Instead, by a party-line vote of 9 to 5, the House Select Committee on Intelligence authorized $80 million for overt aid ''to any friendly country in Central America,'' to help interrupt weapon shipments through such nations from Cuba or Nicaragua to El Salvador. (Page A1, Column 6.) United States covert aid for Afghan insurgents fighting Soviet forces and the Soviet-backed regime in Kabul has been stepped up, Reagan Administration officials said. (A1:4.)

title: Rewards at the Top
description: Ballard Smith, the president of the San Diego Padres, likes teamwork off the field and on. The way Smith sees it, one of the best off-field teams in baseball is the Padres' manager-general manager combination of Dick Williams and Jack McKeon.

title: TERRA MINES LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: THE BIRTH OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUB- LIC OF ANTARCTICA. By John Calvin Batchelor. 401 pages. Dial. $16.95.

title: Wheels Blamed For Derailment
description: A wheel malfunction caused last week's derailment of a 10-car Amtrak passenger train that sent 12 people to hospitals and caused $408,000 in damages, according to officials.

title: Coach to Sleep A Little More
description: Red Miller, the head coach of the Denver Gold of the United States Football League, knows only one way to approach his work. ''I would get up every morning at 5 A.M. and be in my office an hour later,'' he said.

title: REDM INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Good Advice From a Justice
description: As the Supreme Court ponders whether to water down its rule against using illegally seized evidence in criminal trials, former Justice Potter Stewart offers his colleagues some wise counsel: Don't tinker. In three Columbia Law School lectures last week, he made a powerful case that the so-called exclusionary rule is required by the Constitution.

title: MANGOOD CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: During the quarter ended Dec. 31, 1982, the company adopted F.A.S.B. Statement No. 52 on foreign currency translation. Previously reported quarterly earnings for 1982 have been restated to give effect to this change, the company said.

title: THE REGION
description: A Long Island woman is not entitled to $166,950 in winnings from the state Lotto game, because game operators had no record that she had bought the ticket, the state Court of Appeals ruled today.

title: LUMEX INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Share earnings have been adjusted to give effect to a 2-for-1 stock split to be distributed May 20.

title: UNION ELECTRIC STEEL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
GROUP OF WHITES ASSAULTS 3 BLACK MEN IN BROOKLYN
description: Three black men on their way home from their hospital jobs in Brooklyn were assaulted early yesterday by a group of whites in what the police called a racially motivated attack.

title: NEW MEXICO & ARIZONA LAND CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
MODULAR COMPUTER SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: L.I. Divers Search For Missing Boy, 6
description: Police divers began to search an inlet of the Great South Bay in Blue Point, L.I., yesterday for a 6-year-old Holbrook boy missing since Monday afternoon.

title: EDITORS' NOTE
description: Under this heading, The Times amplifies articles or rectifies what the editors consider significant lapses of fairness, balance or perspective. Corrections, also on this page, continue to deal with factual errors.

title: Stern to Allow Experts To Study Hitler 'Diaries'
description: The West German magazine Stern said today that it would allow more experts to study the purported diaries of Hitler because of widespread doubts about their authenticity.

title: PANEL IN ASSEMBLY KILLS BILL ON CHANGING JURY SELECTION
description: A bill supported by Governor Cuomo and Mayor Koch to reform the jury selection process was resoundingly defeated in an Assembly committee today even as the Mayor was defending the proposal before a Senate committee.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: OPERA NOTES

title: HALL, FRANK B, & CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including a gain of $901,000 from an accounting change.

title: ELECTRONIC MODULES CORP reports earnings for qtr to April 2.
description: b-Including a tax credit of $126,942.

title: Excerpts from speech, page A16.
description: Yuri V. Andropov, the Soviet leader, offered today to reduce nuclear medium-range forces in Europe to the present NATO levels in numbers of warheads as well as in numbers of missiles and planes.

title: DIBRELL BROTHERS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
70 Struck Supermarkets Stay Open in Nevada
description: Nonunion workers and several hundred supervisors today opened 70 supermarkets involved in a labor dispute that put 4,000 clerks and meat cutters out of work.

title: GREYHOUND COMPUTER OF CANADA LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
QUEENSTAKE RESOURCES LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
REVUE: 'PARADE OF STARS' FOR ACTORS' FUND BENEFIT
description: LEAPING down the center aisle of the Palace Theater, Al Jolson sprung up onto the stage and belted a medley of his hits. Locked in chains and suspended upside down on a burning rope, Harry Houdini miraculously freed himself from imminent peril in just 84 seconds. Will Rogers ambled from the wings, twirling a lariat, and remarked that ''the Washington Monument is the only thing in town that has any point to it.'' Sophie Tucker sang ''Some of These Days'' and touted a new electric heating pad because ''it doesn't cheat and it doesn't eat.''

title: Helionetics Up 78.3%
description: Helionetics Inc., a high-technology company in Irvine, Calif., said yesterday that, in the first quarter, its earnings surged 78.3 percent, to $505,600, or 10 cents a share, from $283,500, or 7 cents a share, a year earlier. Revenues climbed 72.5 percent, to $2.76 million, from $1.6 million.

title: Europe Jobless Outlook
description: European Chambers of Commerce and Industry expect unemployment to continue to rise this year but more slowly than in 1982 as protectionism threatens to abort a weak economic recovery. The Permanent Conference of European Community Chambers of Commerce and Industry said in its annual report that companies did not now believe any economic revival would last long.

title: FLEXI-VAN CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
BISHOP GRAPHICS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss after losses from discontinued operations of $245,000 for the quarter and $290,000 for the 6 months, each of which included a loss of $181,000 from the disposal of operations.

title: CAPITAL SOUTHWEST CORP reports earnings for As of March 31.
PETER GREENAWAY'S 'THE FALLS'
description: THAT Peter Greenaway is an unusually gifted new film maker was apparent last year when the New York Film Festival presented ''The Draughtsman's Contract,'' an extraordinarily handsome Restoration comedy-mystery that will be released here commercially later this spring. That he has a fully developed absurdist sense of humor was apparent earlier when the festival showed his 1980 short, ''Act of God,'' made up of a series of interviews with people from all walks of life who had survived being struck by lightning.

title: LAKE SHORE MINES LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
STATE IS FINDING EARLY RETIREES MAKE PROBLEMS
description: Thousands of state workers have rushed to retire early in a program intended to reduce the state work force, save the state money and avert some layoffs.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Floral Explosion And Awards in the Park

title: Hecla Shares Sold
description: Amax Inc. continued to reduce its holdings of the Hecla Mining Corporation, the nation's largest silver mining operation, with the sale of 500,000 shares at $22.75 a share.

title: LENDL ASSAILS MCENROE
description: Ivan Lendl said last night that if tennis officials declined to discipline John McEnroe in their future matches, ''I will take it into my own hands.''

title: Full Shares for 11 Knicks
description: After listening to their coach, Hubie Brown, speak for almost two hours yesterday at a farewell luncheon at Madison Square Garden, the Knicks divided the $87,500 in playoff money they earned before they were eliminated by Philadelphia in the Eastern Conference semifinal.

title: A Merciful End
description: That five-game Texas League series between the El Paso Diablos and the Beaumont Golden Gators ended Monday night - mercifully for the pitching staffs.

title: LINCOLN NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
BLAZERS ELIMINATED BY LAKERS
description: The Los Angeles Lakers held off a furious closing surge by the Portland Trail Blazers tonight for a 116-108 victory that clinched their Western Conference semifinal series, four games to one.

title: HYDROMER INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
OLD REPUBLIC INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Includes a realized capital gain of $1,330. c-After a realized capital loss of $182,804.

title: AERO SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $170,000 for the quarter and year for a writedown of certain investments.

title: Jim Palmer Sidelined
description: His arm is fine, but the back problem that has been bothering him all season has finally got the better of Jim Palmer. The Baltimore Orioles' right-hander, who on Sunday was forced to miss a starting assignment for the third time this season, has been placed on the 21-day disabled list in an effort to clear up the muscle pain once and for all.

title: No Headline
description: Transactions BASEBALL BALTIMORE (AL) - Placed Jim P almer, pitcher, on 21-day disabled list be- c ause of stiffness in his neck and lower b ack. MILWAUKEE (AL) - Recalled Chuck P orter, pitcher, from Vancouver of the Pa- c ific Coast League. PHILADELPHIA (NL) - Activated M arty Bystrom, pitcher, and optioned Bob D ernier to its Reading, Pa., farm club. SAN DIEGO (NL) - Ballard Smith, c lub president, extended the contracts of M anager Dick Williams and General Man- a ger Jack McKeon through the 1986 sea- s on.

title: Comings and Goings
description: Ray Meyer, the 69-year-old DePaul basketball coach, will undergo surgery in Chicago tomorrow to deal with a blocked urinary tract. ... Mychal Thompson, the Portland forward, was fined $500 after he missed the team flight to Los Angeles and a practice session before last night's playoff game against the Lakers. ... For the third straight year, Moses Malone, the 76er center, has been named the National Basketball Association's player of the year in a poll of N.B.A. players conducted by The Sporting News. Terry Cummings of the Clippers was named rookie of the year. ... Cummings's agent, meanwhile, says there is ''a real possibility'' that Cummings won't want to take the risk of returning next season because of concern over his heart problems. ... Patti McGuire Connors, the wife of the tennis star Jimmy Connors, has filed for divorce in Miami and is seeking custody of the couple's 3-year-old son, her lawyer, Daniel Heller, said. ... Seninho, the former Cosmos forward, has been signed by the Chicago Sting. ... Representatives of the National Football League Players Association began three days of meetings in Port St. Lucie, Fla., amid speculation that Ed Garvey, the union's executive director, might have to fight for his job because of his handling of last year's strike.

title: CALNY INC reports earnings for year to Feb 26.
MAIL ON TAX WITHHOLDING YIELDS BONANZA OF NAMES
description: On the floor of both the Senate and House, and in town meetings in their home states, members of both political parties complain that the flood of mail on the issue of requiring banks to withhold taxes on interest income is preventing them from attending to other issues.

title: MORAN ENERGY INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
AN AMATEUR COOK CREATES HIS OWN AMERICAN STYLE
description: YOU might say that Marvin Davis is the embodiment of the American gastronomic revolution of the last decade. In his kitchen the oil is pure virgin olive or perhaps almond or hazelnut; his mustards are plain or coarse-grained but imported; his vinegars range in flavors from raspberry to balsamic; his salads often contain radicchio (including the type known as red Treviso), the wild chicories from Italy; he puts sun-dried tomatoes to a dozen different and flavorful uses.

title: A Change for Ross Roy
description: At age 84, Ross Roy, founder of the Detroit agency that bears his name, has taken the big step. He is changing his status at the $222 million agency from employee to consultant and selling his stock back to the agency, as is the custom with such private companies. Glen W. Fortinberry, president and chief executive of Ross Roy Inc., made the announcement, noting that Mr. Roy will still be found in his old office and will still sport the title of chairman of the board.

title: Richard Burton And Familiar Faces
description: WNET/Channel 13, which had $450,000 invested on its behalf in Eva Le Gallienne's ill-fated ' 'Alice in Wonderland'' this season on Broadway, took out some r atings insurance yesterday on the version it will tape in June.

title: Zurich Official Says 3 Swindled Iranian Envoy
description: Three Swiss nationals swindled an Iranian envoy out of $43.4 million by promising him 50 American-built tanks that were never delivered, the Zurich prosecutor said today.

title: RATES FALL ON INVESTOR DEMAND
description: Interest rates fell again yesterday as the outlook for further rate declines brightened enough to stimulate investor demand for the huge supply of Treasury notes and bonds offered this week.

title: VATICAN ASSAILS ARGENTINA JUNTA OVER ITS REPORT ON WAR ON LEFTISTS
description: The Vatican, with unusual force, today criticized the Argentine military Government's statement last week that the thousands of people still missing after its campaign in the 1970's against leftist terrorists must now be considered dead.

title: KELLY SERVICES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Gould Prices Unit At $300 Million
description: Gould Inc., which has been seeking acquisitions in electronics, said it hopes to sell its battery operations for $300 million.

title: IMMIGRATION BILL: THERE STILL ARE FLAWS
description: To the Editor:

title: 'V' SERIES AN NBC HIT
description: For at least two nights, ''V'' stood for victory at NBC, frequently the loser in television's prime-time ratings. But the sizable audiences tuning to the $13-million science fiction miniseries about an alien invasion of Earth were not enough to pull NBC out of third place in the ratings for the week ended last Sunday - the first measurement of the May ''sweeps'' period, when the ratings services track local audiences around the country and the networks compete more keenly for viewers. CBS won the week with 27 percent of the audience, followed by ABC with 25 percent and NBC with 24 percent.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''The nuclear age is an era of moral as well as physical danger.

title: ALLIED PRODUCTS CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
MANHATTAN NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
VULCAN CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Includes a gain of $212,460. c-Includes a gain of $96,256.

title: DIAMOND CRYSTAL SALT CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After a charge of $1.4 million for the quarter and year related to the company's Louisiana mine. c-After charges of $2.2 million for the quarter and $502,000 for the year.

title: TONY LAMA CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Bridge: Experts Like the Challenge Of Individual Competition
description: It is a matter for mild regret that the tournament calendar rarely provides an individual event that appeals to experts. It has some advantages over the traditional team and pair events: it tests adaptability; there is no scope for professionalism, and sophisticated bidding understandings are virtually nonexistent.

title: COLTS ARE GLAD TO GET HINTON FOR ELWAY
description: With the trading of John Elway to the Denver Broncos late Monday night, one of the most unsettling episodes in the history of the Baltimore Colts' franchise ended.

title: FLORIDA DEBATES LAW ON CLASS ON COMMUNISM
description: In 1961, as a member of the Brigada de Asalto, Humberto Cortina was wounded and captured in the Bay of Pigs invasion of his homeland. That ill-planned venture cost him two years in a Cuban prison.

title: E.P.A. NOMINEE GETS RESERVED SUPPORT
description: The Senate Environment and Public Works Committee today began its hearings on the nomination of William D. Ruckelshaus as Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, with conservation groups expressing faint praise and serious reservations.

title: AFP IMAGING CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Greek Premier Praises Senate Decision on Aid
description: Prime Minister Andreas Papandreou today welcomed last week's decision by the Senate Foreign Relations Committee to maintain the 7-to-10 ratio of military aid between Greece and Turkey and to separate the aid issue from the outcome of talks on the future of American bases.

title: Mitterrand Condemns Occupation of Cambodia
description: President Francois Mitterrand of France today condemned Vietnam's occupation of Cambodia, but denounced the Chinese-backed Pol Pot rebels who are part of a coalition fighting to regain power in Phnom Penh.

title: PABST BREWING CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Share earnings are before giving effect to a 4-for-1 stock split payable June 14 that was announced yesterday.

title: DDL FOODSHOW: A TASTER FINDS IT'S GOOD, AND NOT SO GOOD
description: OF all the fancy food shops that have opened in New York in recent years, none has aroused as much curiosity as the DDL Foodshow, the dazzling movie set of a delicatessen conceived and owned, fittingly enough, by the movie producer Dino De Laurentiis. Opened five months ago on Columbus Avenue at 81st Street, the lavishly tiled shop, with its wide brick arches and polished wood and brass, is well named, for a food show it surely is.

title: REAGAN TO CHOOSE CRIME PANEL SOON, OFFICIALS REPORT
description: President Reagan will soon name a bipartisan commission to study the impact organized crime has upon American society, White House and Justice Department officials said today.

title: SAMBO'S PROFIT OUTLOOK
description: Two independent bankruptcy examiners said in a report filed Monday that Sambo's Restaurants Inc. was not likely to return to profitability this year, as the company's new management had predicted in February.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Next Sunday is Mother's Day, and it's not too late to find an appropriate gift, one that suits her taste and personality. Here are some ideas: 1. Festive Packaging Whatever gift you choose to give, it will look more special if it's festively wrapped. The shop called Annie Wrapper that does custom gift-packaging is also selling pre-decorated boxes adorned with ribbons and paper flower bouquets. Because the top lifts off for insertion of the gift, the box may be reused for storage at home. The $12 size, shown, can hold jewelry, a paperweight, pillbox or perfume bottle, scarves, hosiery or sachets. Larger boxes can be made to order. Annie Wrapper is at 956 Lexington Avenue, between 69th and 70th Streets.

title: MUSIC: NEW 'TWAIN SUITE,' BY LEVI, HAS ITS PREMIERE
description: THE pleasures that could be gotten from Paul Alan Levi's ''Mark Twain Suite,'' which was given its premiere by the New York Choral Society in Carnegie Hall on Saturday night, were partly the pleasures of Twain himself. But Mr. Levi, who is on the faculty of New York University, not only judiciously selected his texts, he also set them with a wit, irreverence and folksy charm that perfectly suited their author.

title: Coliseum Aide Replies
description: James Hardy, the Los Angeles Coliseum Commission official who was accused by the Los Angeles Raiders of committing perjury, said yesterday that the accusation was ''scurrilous garbage.'' Mr. Hardy, the commission's general manager, insisted that he had told the truth when he testified that he was not in touch with the N.F.L. commissioner, Pete Rozelle, during the year before the damage phase of the lawsuit brought by the Raiders and the Coliseum against the league. The Raiders say they will refile a new suit against the league today charging that Mr. Hardy gave ''false testimony.''Mr. Hardy suggested that the Raiders were bringing the new suit because he had ''probably cost them money'' when he testified about Coliseum attendance figures.

title: ARROW AUTOMOTIVE INDUSTRIES reports earnings for qtr to March 26.
SCIENCE ACADEMY LOOKING FOR FUNDS
description: In the 120 years since its founding, the National Academy of Sciences has evolved into an unusual institution on the Washington scene.

title: FOR GADGET FANCIERS
description: THE field of kitchen equipment, like that of stereo, video and photography equipment, is heaven for gadget fanciers. New kitchen gadgets seem to appear on the market weekly, some coming from major manufacturers and others from restless tinkerers who spend hours in basement workshops coming up with such kitchen essentials as onion forks (they slice onions in one swoop), shrimp deveiners, cork retrievers (lifelines for stranded wine corks), green-bean strippers, strawberry hullers and egg separators.

title: Help Is Urged for Kids Who See Parents Killed
description: Several thousand children a year suffer lasting psychological damage from witnessing the murder of a parent, according to a Los Angeles psychiatrist who addressed the American Psychiatric Association's meeting in Manhattan yesterday.

title: ELDERLY ENLIST LAWYERS TO GAIN SOCIAL SERVICES
description: The story of Joseph Brill of Geneva, N.Y., is a striking example of why more and more elderly middle-class people in New York State - retired workers who never sought aid from the government during their working lives - are seeking legal advice to do combat with government. For 30 years, Mr. Brill had two jobs. During the week, he was a supervisor at the Hulse Manufacturing Company in Geneva. After working 20 years on the 4 P.M.-to-midnight shift, he was promoted to the preferable day shift. On weekends, he worked as a bartender. His wife, Edith, also worked for Hulse, as a machine operator. They raised three children and managed to save $15,000.

title: VALMAC INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to April 2.
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $1,035,000.

title: MCI COMMUNICATIONS CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
New Chief Is Named At Lea & Perrins Inc.
description: Dennis M. Newnham is taking the reins at Lea & Perrins Inc., the venerable makers of Worcestershire sauce. Mr. Newnham, 42, succeeds James F. Lunn, 62, who is retiring from the office of president after 30 years in the food industry. Lea & Perrins sauce has been sold in the United States since the mid-1830's, Mr. Newnham said.

title: Still Missing in Argentina
description: Argentina's military regime isn't telling the whole truth about the primitive crimes that haunt an unprimitive nation. But the makebelieve is over, which is something.

title: VALERO ENERGY CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
'RENDER UNTO REAGAN'
description: The Reagan Administration can't seem to make up its mind about the proper relationship between church and state. One day it's for the ''separation'' of the two and the next it's for ''collaboration,'' depending on the issue of the moment.

title: CHICAGO MAYOR AND HIS RIVAL MEET AFTER TUMULTUOUS CLASH
description: Mayor Harold Washington and his chief opponent in the City Council met privately today after a tumultuous Council meeting Monday night that was adjourned a moment after it was called to order.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Metropolitan Report on Monday about a symposium on Franz Kafka omitted the names of two sponsors. They are the Leo Baeck Institute and the Germanistic Society of America.

title: REALEX CORP reports earnings for qtr to April 20.
BRADFORD NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including income from discontinued operations of $380,000 and a pretax loss of $528,000 on the sale of an affiliate. c-Net loss.

title: CANADIAN UTILITIES LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
FALASHAS EMANCIPATED BY ETHIOPIA'S REVOLUTION
description: To the Editor:

title: M.T.A. Bonds Priced For Top Yield of 9.35%
description: A $271 million bond financing by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority was tentatively priced with a maximum yield of 9.35 percent for 9 1/4 percent bonds due in 2017. Underwriters led by Dillon, Read & Company said that yields for shorter maturities ranged from 5 1/2 percent for bonds due in 1984 to 8.8 percent for bonds due in 1998 and 9.08 percent for 9 percent bonds due in 2003.

title: BISHOPS ENDORSE STAND OPPOSED TO NUCLEAR WAR
description: By a resounding margin, the Roman Catholic Bishops of the United States today ratified a broad-ranging pastoral letter that denounces nuclear war and calls upon Catholics to help rid the world of nuclear weapons.

title: TERA CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
WEDNESDAY, MAY 4, 1983; Markets
description: Interest rates fell as a result of strong demand for a large supply of Treasury notes and bonds offered this week. Dealers said investor interest increased even as the yield at yesterday's auction for $6.5 billion of three-year notes fell to 9.48 percent from 9.68 percent last Wednesday. (Page D1.)

title: People
description: * Randall Emond, Jeffrey Fischgrund, Jane Fuller, Martha Holmes, James Kieff and Yolan Toro elected senior vice presidents at Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn Inc.

title: Caterpillar Layoffs
description: A week after resuming production following a record 205-day strike, officials of the Caterpillar Tractor Company said the heavy-equipment maker plans to lay off an undetermined number of employees next month.

title: DISABILITY EXAMINERS ARE NO 'BUREAUCRATS'
description: To the Editor:

title: METROPOLITAN DIARY
description: AMONG the thousands of faces at the American Gathering of Holocaust Survivors in Washington last month was that of Marek Stromer, a 70-year-old retired builder who lives on the Upper West Side. It is a strong and expressive face, bearded now, as a reminder of the recent death of his wife, Ruth, and lined, like those of others at the gathering, by the devastation of years in Nazi concentration camps.

title: SOUTHMARK CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Includes tax credits of $7,008,000 for the quarter and $12,572,000 for the 9 months. c-Includes extraordinary credits of $8,790,000 for the quarter and $20,325,000 for the 9 months.

title: LIBERTY CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Mocatta Metals Fills Post of President
description: The Mocatta Metals Corporation, one of the world's largest bullion dealers, has elevated George McLaughlin to be its president. Mr. McLaughlin, 46 years old, has been a vice president since 1977. The president's position has been vacant, he said, and the reason it is now being filled ''is because of growth in the company and Henry's continued involvement with the international aspects.''

title: BRIAN TAYLOR, AT 31, BACK AT PRINCETON
description: Eleven years have passed since Brian Taylor strolled to class at Princeton. He was the school's prize athlete in 1972, celebrated as a premier basketball player, but ridiculed for his decision to leave school early and accept a lot of money to play with the New York Nets of the American Basketball Association.

title: Toyota Suit Settlement
description: A tentative settlement of a multimilliondollar antitrust suit against a regional Toyota distributor has been filed in United States District Court here.

title: ROYALE AIRLINES reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
LOGETRONICS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net income includes a tax credit of $51,000, or 4 cents a share.

title: CITY'S TAX INCENTIVE PANEL IS CALLED SLIPSHOD
description: A New York City panel that has granted millions of dollars in tax incentives to developers operates so haphazardly that city officials often do not know the value of the incentives, whether they are necessary to spur development or who gets them, according to a draft report by the city's Department of Investigation.

title: INTERNORTH INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After a loss of $1,668,000 from discontinued operations.

title: Monsanto to Buy The Rest of Fisher
description: The Monsanto Company said yesterday that it had agreed to acquire the 33.5 percent interest in Fisher Controls International Inc. that it does not own from the General Electric Company P.L.C., a British company, for $178 million.

title: MAUI LAND & PINEAPPLE CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss.

title: PENNINGTON'S STORES LTD reports earnings for year to Jan 29.
HELMERICH & PAYNE INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
NEW YORKERS, ETC.
description: NEW YORKERS usually think of the city as a vast and impersonal metropolis. New Yorkers know better. To them, the city is a series of small neighborhoods and life in that neighborhood very often resembles that of a small town. They may work in one area and live in another but, over a period of time, they not only become attached to supermarkets, fish stores, shoemakers and cleaners but they are also often on sufficiently good terms with tradesmen to cash checks or, if they are short a dollar or two, run in the next day and pay off their indebtedness.

title: PORTA SYSTEMS CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
BRIEFING
description: An Architect's Woes

title: NOVO CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
ADAGE INC reports earnings for qtr to April 2.
Herb-Ox to Stan Merritt
description: Stan Merritt Advertising has become the agency for the Pure Food Company's Herb-Ox bouillon, for which it will be doing about $1 million worth of newspaper, radio and magazine advertising. The job was previously handled by Mintzer, Trostler & Rothschild.

title: Real Estate; Life From Foreclosed Properties
description: UNDER its two-year-old ''shopsteading'' program, New York City seeks to sell tax-foreclosed commercial property to businessmen and women at relatively low prices, and with attractive financing both for purchase loans and for renovation.

title: UNIVERSAL TELEPHONE INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Superior Oil Rift Prompts a Suit
description: Willametta Keck Day, daughter of the founder of Superior Oil Company, has sued the First City National Bank of Houston, charging that a conflict of interest prevents an impartial vote on her resolution that would create an independent committee to consider offers for Superior. The vote will be taken at Superior's annual meeting on May 12.

title: DANCE: BRITISH CONTEMPORARY TROUPE
description: WITH Prince and Princess Michael of Kent sitting in what is turning into the royal box at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, the London Contemporary Dance Theater made its New York debut last night as the final entry in the Academy's six-company ''Ballet International'' series.

title: KLOSS VIDEO CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
TO ATTRACT BUSINESS
description: Because America has largely ignored a crucial, evolving feature of international economic policy - upgrading of national workforces - a number of American firms are training a new generation of foreign competitors.

title: PIONEER CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
I.B.M. Spy Case Tapes
description: The United States Attorney's Office yesterday turned over to a Federal court 12 hours of what it termed potentially ''embarrassing'' videotapes that are said to show Japanese businessmen trying to buy trade secrets belonging to I.B.M.

title: NBC Not for Sale
description: Thornton Bradshaw, chairman of the RCA Corporation, said that the NBC network was not for sale nor in serious trouble. Mr. Bradshaw was asked to comment at a news conference here before the annual meeting on rumors that the network would be sold. ''We are not considering and have not considered selling NBC -that I make as a definitive statement,'' he said. Mr. Bradshaw said that RCA did not expect the imminent sale of its Hertz Corporation unit, which the company has been trying to dispose of for the last year and a half.

title: CHARGES OF 'DIRTY TRICKS' SPLIT CANADA'S TORIES
description: The president of Canada's Conservative Party, which has been caught up in charges of ''dirty tricks'' in the race for the party's leadership, announced recently that from now on members voting for delegates to a June nominating convention would have to be at least 14 years old.

title: Satellite Lineup Used In a Murder Case
description: Law-enforcement officials used space technology to conduct a police lineup of a murder suspect in Sacramento, which was viewed by two witnesses to the crime in Baltimore, Md.

title: 1,000 Removed After Toxic Leak
description: About 1,000 residents were removed from their homes in this Columbia County village today after a toxic chemical was found to be leaking from a Conrail tanker car, according to county sheriff's deputies.

title: SIGMA-ALDRICH CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
WRIGHT-HARGREAVES MINES LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
THE POP LIFE
description: IF a band is defined as a self-contained ensemble of specific musicians, some of the newer rock bands aren't really bands at all. The pop charts in America and especially in England have recently been infiltrated by a rash of two-man ''bands'' that consist of an electronics specialist, who synthesizes all the music, and a singer. But there's also Material, the increasingly successful and important New York-based ''band'' that consists of a synthesizer player, a bass player, and a recording engineer who sometimes plays percussion instruments.

title: NEW TRADE AGENCY OUTLINED
description: Commerce Secretary Malcolm Baldrige today gave the first details of the Administration's plans for what he called a ''lean and mean'' cabinet-level Department of Trade.

title: BRISTOL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including a gain of $142,186, or 7 cents a share, on the sale of real estate.

title: AUTO-TROL TECHNOLOGY CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: Security Pacific Plans Bank in South Dakota
description: The Security Pacific Corporation of Los Angeles, seeking further expansion into insurance and other financial services, announced yesterday that it would soon file an application to start a statechartered bank in South Dakota, which recently enacted a law that permits state-chartered banks to own insurance companies.

title: OBSCURE GERMAN PILGRIMS STAR IN A TRICENTENNIAL
description: Three hundred years ago, 13 families from Krefeld, subjects of the Dutch House of Orange, left their homes to make a new life in a God-fearing community being founded in America by an Englishman named William Penn.

title: TODD SHIPYARDS CORP reports earnings for qtr to April 3.
description: The results for 1983 include a nonrecurring charge, after taxes, of $2,800,000 for the previously nounced disposition of the company's Brooklyn and Almeda operations.

title: Platinum Cash Prices At Premium Over Gold
description: Platinum cash prices sold at a premium over gold yesterday for the first time since Sept. 11, 1981. This came a day after platinum futures moved to a premium over gold, after having sold at discounts of as much as $131 an ounce since 1981.

title: REPUBLICAN LEADS IN SAN DIEGO MAYORAL TALLY
description: With more than three-quarters of the votes tallied, Roger Hedgecock, a Republican county supervisor, held a narrow lead tonight in the race to become Mayor of San Diego.

title: GENRAD INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Share earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split declared in February.

title: DEATH OF GERMAN PROMPTS PROTESTS
description: Hundreds of demonstrators today protested the death of a West German doctor killed last week in a guerrilla ambush in Nicaragua and linked the killing to United States activities in Central America.

title: U.S. SAID TO INCREASE ARMS AID FOR AFGHAN REBELS
description: The United States has stepped up the quantity and quality of covert military support for Afghan insurgents fighting Soviet forces and the Soviet-backed Government in Kabul, according to Administration officials.

title: A BRINK'S WITNESS TESTIFIES ON THE CHESIMARD ESCAPE
description: Joanne Chesimard, a Black Liberation Army leader, broke out of prison with the help of a radical group that took her to two hideouts and then smuggled her out of the country to the Bahamas, according to testimony yesterday at the Federal Brink's trial in Manhattan.

title: STAGE: SHEL SILVERSTEIN'S 'WILD LIFE'
description: WHOEVER the ubiquitous Shel Silverstein is, he's certainly unpredictable. He first came to prominence as a somewhat inane court jester to Hugh Hefner, supplying cartoons to the pages of Playboy magazine. Mr. Silverstein has also performed his own ribald ballads on records and, in recent years, become a successful children's author. His current book, ''A Light in the Attic,'' is so popular with kids of all ages that it's been on the adult best-seller list for months.

title: LED MAJOR LANDING IN 2 WARS
description: Adm. Arthur Dewey Struble, retired, a much-decorated Navy commander whose 41-year career encompassed the direction of naval operations off Omaha Beach in World War II and Inchon in the Korean War, died Sunday at his home in Chevy Chase, Md. He was 88 years old.

title: Support for Mexico
description: The president of soccer's world governing body, contending that financial sporting interests in the United States do not provide sufficient support for soccer, has reaffirmed Mexico's status as the leading candidate to stage the 1986 World Cup. Joao Havelange, the Brazilian head of the Federation Internationale de Football Association, said the best stadiums in the United States were for baseball and that American concern to be host to the championship appeared to be commercial rather than sporting. Yesterday, in a resolution adopted by voice vote, the House encouraged the world group to visit the United States and reconsider the American application to serve as host.

title: FIRST CITY PROPERTIES INC reports earnings for qtr to Jan 31.
description: b-Including tax credits of $193,000, or 2 cents a share, for the quarter and $3.2 million, or 38 cents a share, for the year. c-Net loss. d-Including a tax credit of $3.7 million, or 42 cents a share.

title: CAMPANELLI INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to Jan 31.
description: b-Including a gain of $184,998 from the repurchase of debentures.

title: Action on Wagner Is Ruled Illegal
description: A Brooklyn judge ruled yesterday that the Board of Education's selection of Deputy Mayor Robert F. Wagner Jr. as its original choice for Schools Chancellor was illegal because the board's use of closed sessions violated the state's open-meetings law.

title: TRINITY INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: The year-ago figures have been restated.

title: CAVCO INDUSTRIES reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
RSR CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: Theatrical Costume Exhibit
description: When Charles Frederick Worth, couturier to the court of Napoleon III, began designing for the leading ladies of the stage of his era, theatrical costume and fashion met for the first time.

title: HOUSE PANEL IS SAID TO DENY REAGAN BID FOR MORE IN MILITARY
description: The House Armed Services Committee voted today to reject the Reagan Administration's request to add more than 37,000 troops to the active armed services, according to a Congressional source.

title: DATAMARINE INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for qtr to April 2.
The U.N. Today; May 4, 1983; GENERAL ASSEMBLY
description: Special Committee on the Charter of the United Nations and on the Strengthening of the Role of the Or- ganizations - 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: High Honors May Be Entered
description: A jet will be standing by at Kennedy International Airport in New York on Thursday morning, and whether it takes off could well affect the outcome of the 109th Kentucky Derby here Saturday. If more than 20 horses are entered for the Derby, the plane will probably stay in the hangar. But if 20 names or fewer are dropped into the entry box, a colt named High Honors will be loaded into the cargo hold and flown here to run.

title: PUNISHMENT DEMANDED BY THE PEOPLE
description: To the Editor:

title: INTERPROVINCIAL PIPE LINE LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
SILENCE AFTER A BOMBING
description: To the Editor:

title: Boy Is Fatally Shot In Theft Attempt
description: A 14-year-old Brooklyn boy was shot in the head while attempting to break into a house and died yesterday at St. Mary's Hospital, 14 hours later, the police said.

title: You Name It, They Catch It
description: A mong the objects thrown onstage at the Ritz Theater yesterday were a green telephone, a black cleated boot, a wine glass, a stapler, a hunk of tofu, a plush teddy bear, a Sunday Times, two dead goldfish in plastic bags, a brick, a dumbbell and a box of egg matzohs (kosher for Passover).

title: DOMTAR INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
SOTHEBY MAY ATTRACT SECOND BIDDER
description: A second American company is considering a bid for Sotheby Parke Bernet, the auction house, at a price higher than that offered by Marshall S. Cogan and Stephen C. Swid, and has acquired a limited number of Sotheby's shares on the Stock Exchange.

title: Fotomat Suit
description: The Fotomat Corporation has agreed to pay $10 million to 23 holders of its photo-processing franchises to settle a six-and-a-half-year-old antitrust suit.

title: M/A-COM INC reports earnings for qtr to April 2.
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,200,000 for the quarter and $1,800,000 for the 6 months. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $792,000 for the quarter and $1,600,000 for the 6 months, and a gain of $865,000 for the 6 months from the sale of the company's investment in stock warrants of a new specialized common carrier.

title: O'NEILL CRITICIZES G.O.P. OVER DELAY
description: Democratic frustration with the pace of legislation in the House erupted today as Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. accused the Republicans of being ''obstructionists'' who were ''bent on stalling everything along the line.''

title: SIZE OF QUAKE PROVES PUZZLE TO GEOLOGISTS
description: Monday's damaging earthquake in California originated at a depth of about six miles under what local oilmen call the Anticline Ridge in a series of features geologists consider among the most puzzling in California.

description: b-Net income.

SALES GROWTH LAGS FOR BLACK CONCERNS
description: Total sales of the top 100 black-owned businesses grew by 14.1 percent last year and came to a new high of $2.17 billion, even though the recession and tight money slowed down the rate of growth from previous years, according to an annual survey by Black Enterprise magazine that was released yesterday.

title: James B. Kobak Jr. is a New York lawyer.
description: ASTOUNDING developments in word-processing equipment proceed apace. If this rate of progress continues, the word-processor will ultimately rival that triumph of technology, the food processor, in expense, cachet and complexity of design. Eventually cybernetics may be able to do for the English lexicon what the Cuisinart already can do for vegetables and calves' liver.

title: WAJDA LOSES POLISH FILM POST
description: The Polish authorities announced today that the film maker Andrzej Wajda had been dismissed as head of X Group, a Government movie production unit.

title: U.S. Joins In G.M. Bid
description: The Justice Department agreed today to join the General Motors Corporation in seeking to end a 30-year-old court order preventing the company from favoring its wholly owned financing subsidiary.

title: HATCHER CLAIMS VICTORY IN GARY PRIMARY RACE
description: Mayor Richard G. Hatcher claimed victory tonight in his Democratic Mayoral primary race against Thomas J. Crump, a three-term City Councilman.

title: WEDNESDAY SPORTS
description: Baseball Mets vs. Houston Astros, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadows, Queens, 7:35 P.M. Rick Ownbey lost his last outing, against Atlanta on Saturday.

title: GREYHOUND CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Economic Scene; Strange New Robotic World
description: THESE days, the line between the human and nonhuman is getting blurred. In Japan, where the robots have been moving into the workplace faster than anywhere else in the world, one gets a sense of the strange new world to be.

title: MODINE MANUFACTURING CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: The company is listed on the Midwest Stock Exchange.

title: AMERICA DON'T TAKE ITALY FOR GRANTED
description: The United States must stop taking for granted that Italy will remain loyal and compliant toward its leadership. Suspicions about America's tendency to confuse its self-interest with the entire alliance's strategic needs are now found clear across Italy's political landscape. The Reagan Administration's plan to infuse Europe's younger generation with more favorable attitudes toward America will fail as spectacularly in Italy as elsewhere on the Continent.

title: OVERSEAS SECURITIES CO INC reports earnings for As of March 31.
description: Assets figures represent net assets.

title: EX-SOLDIER WHO FOUGHT FOR PEACE READY TO REST
description: Time is fast running out for Joseph Polowsky. But he is still trying to rekindle the kind of peaceful understanding he first encountered in a German lilac field littered with bodies.

title: FOOD NOTES
description: Beard, 80, Hopeful, but -

title: U.S. WELCOMES AND REJECTS ASPECTS OF SOVIET OFFER
description: The Reagan Administration today welcomed Soviet willingness to negotiate ceilings on nuclear warheads in Europe but said it could not accept renewed Soviet demands for equality with the combined NATO nuclear forces.

title: Hebrew National Signs With Geers, Gross
description: Geers, Gross Advertising has been named agency for Hebrew National Kosher Foods, which has also named Levy, Flaxman & Associates to handle its recently acquired fresh chicken and turkey operation.

title: June Bout Looms
description: Bob Arum, the president of Top Rank Inc., said yesterday that he is hoping to reschedule the Roberto Duran-Davey Moore fight for late June at Madison Square Garden.

title: ELLEN ZWILICH CONSIDERS PULITZER DOUBLE VICTORY
description: Like most recipients of prestigious awards, Ellen Taaffe Zwilich, who won this year's Pulitzer Prize for music, was extremely pleased. But Mrs. Zwilich has a double cause for pleasure - her triumph itself and the fact that she was the first woman to win the music prize in its 40-year history.

title: CELLU-CRAFT INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including a tax credit of $71,000. Share earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid April 14.

Abolishing Credit Urged at Casinos
description: Casinos in Atlantic City should not be permitted to extend credit to gamblers, should not get tax write-offs for bad debts and should be required to eject patrons who may have criminal backgrounds, the State Commission of Investigation recommended today.

title: BRUINS COLLAPSE LEAVES CHEEVERS GROPING
description: It was 13 years to the day after Gerry Cheevers, the Boston Bruins' coach, had one of his most satisfying moments. He turned in a superlative job in goal for the Bruins as they routed the St. Louis Blues, 6-1, in the opening game of Boston's 1970 Stanley Cup sweep.

title: CONSOLIDATED PIPE LINES CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
LESSONS OF 'MODERATE' COAST EARTHQUAKE
description: The earthquake that shook much of the agriculturally bountiful San Joaquin Valley on Monday was a blunt reminder, disaster planning officials said, of how poorly prepared California is for the ''great earthquake'' that geologists have long said is inevitable.

title: ASTROS, ON 5-RUN 2D, TOP METS
description: A familiar, frustrating pattern continued for the Mets last night as they lost for the fourth straight time and the 14th in 20 games. This time, in a 7-4 loss to the Houston Astros, it was a pair of errors that led to four unearned runs against Craig Swan in the Astros' five-run second inning.

title: PAR TECHNOLOGY reports earnings for qtr to March 31.

description: b-Net income.

SUCCESSOR TO MARGIOTTA A CLOSE FRIEND AND ALLY
description: As he had so often done as a close friend and longtime political ally, Joseph N. Mondello was sitting on a couch in the offices of Joseph M. Margiotta on Monday morning when the call they had been anxiously awaiting from Washington came in.

title: Topics; International Conflicts; Avenging Daisy
description: The situation - a woman writer debating the proposition that ''This house believes that feminism is good for men'' at Cambridge University -might have tempted Virginia Woolf. But on examining Betty Friedan's dialogue with her opposition - young men in evening clothes and what she said were masks of ''foppish humor'' - we think of Henry James.

title: CARDIFF EQUITIES reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After a loss of $2,312,000 from discontinued operations.

title: NEW MARCHES BROKEN UP IN POLISH CITIES
description: Eight thousand people took to the streets of Warsaw today in a spontaneous, hand-clapping demonstration. In the seaport of Gdansk, the police broke up a march by 3,000 people chanting ''Solidarity,'' according to Western reporters, and there were clashes in Lublin, Cracow and Nowa Huta.

title: EXCERPTS FROM ARMS SPEECH WITH ANDROPOV'S PROPOSAL
description: Following are excerpts from a speech yesterday by Yuri V. Andropov, the Soviet leader, as distributed in translation by the Soviet press agency Tass:

title: Advertising; JWT Chief Is Angered At Charges
description: DON Johnston, chairman of the JWT Group, departed from his prepared speech yesterday at the company's annual meeting to brand as ''ridiculous'' and ''utter nonsence'' published charges being made by Marie Luisi.

title: BENJAMIN EPSTEIN, DIRECTOR OF LEAGUE FIGHTING PREJUDICE
description: Benjamin R. Epstein, national director of the Anti-Defamation League of B'nai B'rith from 1947 to 1978, died of cancer Monday at his home in Manhattan. He was 70 years old.

title: ABOUT NEW YORK
description: Public School 15 is on one side of East Fourth Street between Avenues C and D. On the other side of the street are four bricked-up abandoned buildings and a grocery store that is never open.

title: HOW THE INSPECTION SYSTEM WORKS TO KEEP NEW YORK'S FOOD SAFE
description: THE food New Yorkers buy in retail stores is as safe today, if not safer, than it was a decade ago, despite budget cuts that have curtailed public inspection staffs, according to both official and private sources who monitor food in the marketplace. However, these same sources concede that trying to prove there is little danger in what we eat is tricky: at best, if there are few reported calamities, the assumption is that things are being well run. It is widely believed that only a tiny percentage of food-connected illnesses are identified and traced to the source - the figure most cited by health authorities is 1 in 10. Many people recover without consulting a physician, and those who do seek medical care often fail to make a definite connection between their malady and a specific meal.

title: LITTLE LONG LAC GOLD MINES LTD reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Year-ago results have been restated to reflect the proposed reassessment of mining duties.

title: LACK OF MONEY IMPERILS SALVADORAN ELECTIONS
description: National elections scheduled for later this year will have to be postponed if the Government does not provide an infusion of money to the Central Electoral Council soon, according to a member of the council.

title: CLAIMS IN MISSOURI SHOW COMPLEXITY OF TOXIC WASTE CLEANUP AND BUYOUTS
description: David and Dorothy Smith had planned to supplement their retirement income by developing a wooded 13-acre tract they owned here. But all their plans went out the window last August when they learned that Romaine Creek, which runs through their property, was heavily contaminated with dioxin.

title: EQUITABLE GAS CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.

description: The Xerox Corporation said it would sell its Xerox Magnetics subsidiary, which makes magnetic data-storage disks, to Kearney-National Inc., a New York-based manufacturer of electrical and electronic products.

title: Series EE Bonds Will Pay 8.64%
description: The United States Treasury announced it would pay 8.64 percent interest on the new EE savings bonds issued between May 1 and Oct. 31. This rate is down sharply from the 11.09 percent rate paid on the same series of bonds during the six-month period ended April 30, reflecting the generally lower level of interest rates.

title: HELEN OF TROY (CO) reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After tax credits of $34,872 for the latest quarter and $4,399 for the year- earlier period.

description: James A. Dombrowski, a civil rights activist in the South and former executive director of the Southern Conference Educational Fund Inc., died Monday at the Touro Infirmary in New Orleans after a long illness. He was 86 years old.

title: The Westway 'Luxury' Is a Bargain
description: Westway is back in the news, and once again its critics cheer. Asked by candidate Cuomo last fall to investigate charges of impropriety in planning of the highway and development project, Thomas Puccio, the former Abscam prosecutor, has brought Governor Cuomo a ringing verdict: ''Whatever merit the Westway project originally had, it has now become a luxury the city and state probably cannot afford.''

description: * American Electric Power Co. said its Ohio Power Co. unit planned to sell up to $130 million of bonds through competitive bidding from time to time.

description: The state's highest court ruled today that a former New York City police officer, Frank Serpico, must make full support payments for his child born out of wedlock, even though he said the child's mother had told him she was using contraception.

title: SCIENTIFIC SOFTWARE CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Possible Herbicide Ills Are Reported by U.S.
description: Vietnam veterans have made more than 369,000 visits to Veterans Administration hospitals for illnesses that could have been caused by Agent Orange, the Veterans Administration said today in its first report on the chemical's possible effect on American soldiers in Southeast Asia.

title: MAGNETICS INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.

Topics; International Conflicts; Swift-Kick Diplomacy
description: As if responding to President Reagan's recent appeals for bipartisan diplomacy, Henry Kissinger and Cyrus Vance are urgently collaborating to make the United States host to the 1986 World Cup soccer matches. What a suggestive venture.

title: Market Place; Drugstore Chains Backed
description: WHILE investors ponder a possible correction in stock prices, the Value Line Investment Survey has singled out a rather mundanesounding group that has done superbly in the market and is considered likely to continue its winning ways: the chain drugstore group.

Paradyne Cites Testimonial
description: The Paradyne Corporation, accused of violating Federal securities laws in obtaining a $100 million Government contract, denied the charges today and offered evidence to show that the Social Security Administraion was satisfied with the company's equipment.

description: The family of George Balanchine gathered to pay its last respects yesterday morning at simple religious services at the Russian Orthodox Cathedral of Our Lady of the Sign, where Mr. Balanchine worshiped.

description: Richard E. Schuler, a member of the State Public Service Commission since 1981, said said today that he had been teaching full time at Cornell University since January and that he planned to resign his state post by next fall.

description: The Commerce Department issued a preliminary ruling today that Japanese and Australian cement is selling in the United States at less than fair value.
